Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: john g
Reviews.Content: Booked after seeing the great reviews on tripadvisor. This is an intimate but neat hotel in the trendy Montparnasse area , surrounded by a wide selection of bars and restaurants. It should be proud of the friendly , helpful staff where nothing seemed to be too much trouble . The rooms were both distinctive and well presented if a little small. I doubt that there is anything better on offer for the price in what is a fabulous but very expensive city. Well done Le Fabe !!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: solodrifter
Reviews.Content: I have nothing negative to say about this hotel! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful as far as tourism,transportation etc. Additionally the staff presented a warm welcoming attitude by showing sincere concern with your level of comfort. Next aspect, i was impressed with was the setting of this hotel. It was very modern and each room offered it's own distinct character. the art work was simple but very decorative. The rooms were small but sufficient, and the cover was soft, thick and clean. In addition with the above, the hotel was in a great location. it was very close walking distance to public transportation(Metro). Also there were plenty restaurants near if one did not fell like traveling far. The room also has refrigerators which is extremely convenient since there is a store across the street from this great hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Funky n Fabe!”
Reviews.Author: Kormak
Reviews.Content: So it was my first time visiting Paris and thus I don’t know what I’m really comparing this little hotel to! How and ever, I booked Le Fabe on Tripadvisor reviews alone and it’s fair to say I wasn’t disappointed. The staff are really courteous, the rooms and décor are really boutiquey and funky. The beds and pillows were REALLY COSY! Which is strange for hotels! The “petit dejeuner” was plain and simple, probably a little bit pricey but nice all the same. Free Wifi was handy to stay in touch with the relatives. Finally the location is fine… a 5 minute walk away from Pernety Metro. … Nice to stroll to and fro and take in the sights and sounds of this peaceful Parisian neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: Steve T
Reviews.Content: The Le Fabe exceeded even our high expectations. The room and the service were excellent. The staff were always helpful and friendly. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Firestormin
Reviews.Content: If you want somewhere comfortable, within easy commute of central Paris (15 mins via the Metro to St Germain with local Metro station just 3 minutes walk away) and you want to avoid the usual tourist haunts and feel a bit more 'involved' in real Parisian life then you can't do much better than Le Fabe! With reasonable sized, well kept rooms, clean towels on tap, and if you're lucky enough to be in a ground floor room, a proper coffee machine thrown in, this place is hard to beat. There are some good eateries within walking distance too (particularly La Cantine du Troquet) as well as some nice Boulangeries to call into for breakfast. From our experience the staff were amazing, with nothing being too much trouble, even trying to help us book venues to eat in before we'd arrived and helping us with our 'pronunciation' and other challenges. All this, and great value for money. So if you don't mind being away from the usual tourist traps then this place comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cate5606
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves it award for best service hotel. We had a great stay in one of the larger rooms. Good size rooms , really clean and very welcoming staff. Come out of pernaty metro turn right and its literally a three minute walk away on rue d l'ouest. We ate in a restaurant on the corner beside the hotel (they will recommend it if you ask the name!). It was extremely tasty and had a great atmosphere "very french". Only other recommendations if you're a first time visitor to paris is to book the eiffel tower online in advance (get to skip the queue) and take the highlights of the louvre tour if your not an art buff. Its an hour and a half long and just shows the masterpieces.

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel”
Reviews.Author: InstantGratification
Reviews.Content: Having heard so much about unfriendly & rude people in France, it was a trip that we(my partner and I) made with a little apprehension. I really don't know about the other visitors, but for us,Paris was a fantastic experience. Right from the people helping us to get around Paris, they were more than willing to explain the route in their fluent french and somewhat broken english. We never felt unwelcome, rather it reminded me of India where people sometimes go out of their way to help. Coming back to the hotel review, the front desk is simply one of the best I have seen across all hotels I have ever visited. Alex(whom I did not meet in person, but was very helpful during online queries), Adrian and Sua(i hope i got his name right) were extremely helpful. Sua spent a good 20 mins explaining the entire route to get to the Eiffel and nearby attractions. His suggestion to check out the river cruise and the sparkling Eiffel at night meant that a good trip turned into a fantastic one(the hourly sparkling lights is a sight to behold, my girlfriend was dancing with delight :)). We thoroughly enjoyed the Metro travel, interacting with various people and visiting the sights. Sua also made sure that we got a nice room named the "French Romance" ;) Although the room isn't that big(compared to European hotels, it's big), it was well maintained with very comfy beds and a wonderful bathroom(with a Bathtub). The lighting was sensuous and was quite pleasing :) There is a nice view to the street and the big windows are an added bonus. Breakfast in the morning is your regular fare, with a continental breakfast for 10 Euros. This includes coffee and other beverages. It was quite decent but you need to arrive early since items out of stock don't get replenished(we missed out on the chocolate bread). The hotel is located in a very nice neighbourhood, with lots of eating options(Le Fabe doesn't have a regular restaurant-they serve only Breakfast)ranging from regular Bistros, to roadside cafes, a vegetarian restaurant(!!) and a few pizzerias. The commute to central Paris is 2 stops away,from Pernety to Montparnesse and a line change to Bir-Hakeim(the Eiffel station) and very convenient. You also have stores where you can pickup mobile food(sandwiches/wraps and juice) All in all, a highly recommended hotel for everyone, specially first time travellers.The Hotel was good value for money and I will surely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were accurate”
Reviews.Author: PaulPal
Reviews.Content: This small, tucked-away hotel lived up to its billing; it is clean, neatly decorated in a modern style that is continued into the breakfast area, where the bread is what you would expect of France (good!) and the coffee as good as you can get from a machine - something I did not expect to see in France and haven't (yet?) experienced in other coffeephile countries like Italy. The hotel staff are its chief asset, though, helpful without being obsequious and attentive to your wellbeing at all times. Exceptional! (Last point: it was lovely and warm and after we had nearly frozen to death in the Stade waiting for a rugby match that didn't happen, it was a great place to return to.)

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, trendy hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: 90basso
Reviews.Content: 21yr old male travelling with 61 yr old mother. Just make sure you head the right way out of the metro (if that's how you are arriving). ALL the staff we encountered were very helpful and friendly (sorry I forgot your names but thank you so much for making it a great stay). I had mentioned I was going to be turning 21 when I was there and they even left a note wishing me in the room when I arrived. Rooms were named which was nice too. A good few little shops in the area between the hotel and metro if you need to pick up a few things or breakfast etc. Also have a computer that you can use to access internet if you don't have a laptop etc to use the wifi. The only negative was that the rooms were a bit small BUT it is Paris so I assume that's almost assumed.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Vrabbit79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at le Fabe for 3 nights at the beginning of February. Booked on the basis of Trip Advisor recommendation, reasonable prices and the modern look of the hotel. We were not disappointed. Really friendly staff, modern and clean. Good location - nice area, close to metro stop although we walked to more central areas like st germain on a couple of occasions. To summarise great hotel and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fab at Le Fabe”
Reviews.Author: turgoose
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel with high expectations and it delivered on every level. Recieved a free upgrade on arrival, great location in a 'real' part of Paris with staff that cannot help enough. Great breakfast and good recommendations for local restaurants. We're planning to go back to Paris in the Summer and wouldn't stay anywhere else. If your thinking about booking this hotel don't, just do it you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Boutique Hotel in Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Amyoconnor
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in February 2012 and were very happy with the experience. This part of the 14th is extremely trendy now with lots of great restaurants, cheese shops, bakeries and like just a block or two in any direction. The metro is a short 2-3 minute walk away and all tourist locations in central Paris are no more than 15 minutes away by metro. The famous flea market at the Porte de Vanves is just two metro stops south as well. The hotel is particularly convenient if flying into Orly, as it took just 30 minutes by train or 20 in a cab to get to and from the airport. The room we had (Lotus) was large by Paris standards and the bathroom was well fitted out. The service was excellent at the front desk, very helpful. For 300 euros for a two-night Friday/Saturday stay in central Paris - booked at the last minute - I found this to be great value. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab stay at le Fabe!”
Reviews.Author: shendrick
Reviews.Content: Hotel le Fabe is Fab! On arrival we were upgraded for free due to the hotel not being full mid week, great start! The hotel is in a residential area of Paris which is nice is you like being out of the hustle and bustle of the centre and want to feel a bit more 'parisian'. Great little restaurants all around the area, safe to walk out and about in the evening and right next to Pernety tube station enabling you to get in and out of the centre of Paris in no time. We got a 2 day pass on the tube zones 1-3 which got us all over the city for a really reasonable price. Didn't opt for breakfast at the hotel, however the staff were more than happy to provide us with hot drinks after a freezing day sightseeing for a tiny charge. To wrap up, Great location, great staff, clean, modern and cosy!

Reviews.Title: “Great little zen hotel, good non-touristy location”
Reviews.Author: Andrea D
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2011 and loved both the hotel and the location. They have a great website on which you can view each of the rooms, which was partly why I chose this particular hotel. The location is great - not far from the big Gare Montparnasse, and a stone's throw from the metro station Pernety. There are lovely bistros, fleuristes, patisseries and boulangeries right near the hotel so plenty of amenities right outside. Great service, and a cup of tea upon arrival which was nice after a tiring journey! The hotel is clean, beautiful and quiet. The interior design is superb, with gorgeous en-suite shower room. I would recommend this little gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place and location!!”
Reviews.Author: ManitobaLass
Reviews.Content: I booked this place based on Trip Advisor reviews and agree that the great reviews were completely accurate. When booking, my only concern was the location as it appeared to be away from the main tourist spots, but as with other reviews I think this turned out to be one of the best areas to stay! I am so happy we stayed in a quieter area that had great restaurants, bakeries, and shops and was very close to the Metro so everything in the city was just a quick ride away. It was so nice to come back to this area after a long day of site-seeing too. We ended up having all our dinners in the area. Also to note, the concierge really is so helpful. He recommended some great places to eat and had good tips for site-seeing. I thought the room was perfect for us. We were only there to sleep so we didn't need a huge room. It was clean, the bathrooms nice and people need to understand that most Parisien hotel rooms are not big, so I was pleasantly surprised that it really was a decent size. Highly recommend this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Best-kept secret!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HeleneBoudreauJean
Reviews.Content: Everything positive you read about this hotel is completely accurate. I am a freelance writer and have written quite a bit for the New Brunswick, Canada department of Tourism. I can tell you that I am difficult to please when it comes to travel accommodations. My daughter and I stayed here for one night only, regrettably, and were overly-impressed with the charm of the Hotel Le Fabe. We walked in from the biting cold and our host, Alexandre, prepared for us a wonderful hot beverage. He gave us important tourist information and helpful tips we wouldn't have gotten otherwise. I suspect Alexandre is a major reason this hotel has received awards and accolades. Our room was small by Canadian standards, but oh so spotlessly clean and comfortable. The bed was a bit hard for my liking, but my daughter loved it, so it's a question of taste. There was plenty of hot water and the shower was fantastic. I thought the water would smell and taste horrible, but I was wrong; the water must be filtered or treated because it was as good as my well-water here at home. Our room was directly on the street, but it was very quiet and we heard no noise whatsoever from the other rooms. There was a hot beverage machine in the room to which we availed ourselves. There was also a wall-mounted flat screen TV, but we did not turn it on. I can't say enough about the quality of this gem of hotel and I plan on returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca T
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and polite. The hotel is located in certal of paris. The rooms was very clean. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nikthomas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner last August and had a great time. They staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were a good size, clean and modern. The hotel was a very good price but was about 10-15mins on the metro to the centre of Paris but it was very close to a metro station so this wasn't much of a problem for us. There are small independent restaurants near by that were amazing and very cheap. In the mornings we went to the local bakery and bought food rather than paying for breakfast in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Crabcakeahoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights during the first week of January. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The room wasn't that big but was clean and modern. The hotel is close to the metro and we found it easy to get to all the places we wanted. There were plenty of shops and cafes around the area also. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: EmilyK2008
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful via email advising us on our stay in Paris, helping us arrange airport transportation, making dinner reservations for us, etc. When we arrived in the early morning, there was a room available, so they allowed us to check in at 8:00 in the morning. If nothing had been available, they were going to hold our luggage for us until we were able to check in. The room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. The hotel is in a pretty neighborhood with some nice cafes, and is a very short walk to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay for New Year!”
Reviews.Author: Sminty2012
Reviews.Content: Went away for New Year and upon arrival, the reception from the front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful and serviced our every need. We were offered drinks after our travel from the station, which was really appreciated and free Champagne and chocolates for New Year. The room itself was great - very clean. The service throughout was a very high standard and we both enjoyed our stay there. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service, and price!”
Reviews.Author: janyyz
Reviews.Content: Really liked this place. The staff was really patient when we needed help and directions, rooms were extremely clean, modern, and it's on a quiet street. Nothing negative I can think of.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Junith
Reviews.Content: Went away for a long weekend in Paris for my wife's birthday, upon arrival, the reception from the front desk staff was extremely friendly and warm. We were offered drinks after our travel from the station, which was really appreciated. The room itself looked good, very trendy and clean. The service throughout was a very high standard and we both enjoyed our stay there. The staff there do their best to make you feel welcome, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, great value.”
Reviews.Author: BiggerJ
Reviews.Content: Quiet location, but very nice hotel. We had a romantic weekend here, and we're very impressed by the charming service and the cleanliness of the small rooms. This is as far south as you want to stay on the Left bank - it gets a bit boring and residential south of here; but this is rescued by the proximity of the Pernetty metro. This is reflected by the very keen pricing. it's also nice to be in a real neighbourhood, rather than a tourist strip. There are some lovely shops and eating places on rue de l'Ouest and rue Raymond Losserand. We particularly recommend the Cantine du Tronquet (separate review). Overall, I'd happily recommend this as great value and a really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jb162
Reviews.Content: Having booked Le Fabe hotel because of the reviews on this site I was not disappointed. From the moment we booked the service was first class. I emailed the hotel several times asking for information and transfers and other general advice and always recieved a fast response. We were arrived we were very pleased with hotel, good location not right in the centre of tourist trap and room was good size and great bathroom! Would def recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: julie999
Reviews.Content: Le Fabe was a lovely small hotel, in a great spot just a few stops on the Metro into Paris. Our room was small, just enough space for our things for 2 nights, not really big enough for much longer. I think there are larger rooms. In comparison the bathroom was rather large. Room, clean, lovely soft bed and bedding. Breakfast was buffet style continental, including boiled eggs, everything was lovely and fresh. Staff were fantastic and very pleasant. The area around hotel is great, small supermarket across the road, metro station 2 minutes away, lots of little shops, bars and restuarants all within walking distance as was Montpanasse railway station. Would definately go back....

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Plus”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaChris
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Le Fabe mid-morning we were immediately and personally greeted. Alex knew who we were, offered us a beverage, and made several suggestions of what we might like to do while our room was being prepared, as the previous occupants were checking out as we were arriving. When we chose to sit and have a cafe au lait, he brought us croissants to enjoy. This was the beginning of a delightful stay, as the entire staff was equally helpful and concerned for our comfort. The rooms are modern and of a European size, but the bath was larger than we often encounter. I would recommend this hotel without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: CCP1979
Reviews.Content: From the warm welcome, to the cosy and comfortable luxurious rooms, free wifi, great breakfast, we really enjoyed our stay. The location is great, in a lively and authentic quartier with plenty of bars and restaurants. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew Y
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple and we choose this hotel principally due to the good reviews that it had recieved. I am pleased to say that these review were definitely justified... The hotel itself is modern, clean, elegant and the staff do their upmost to ensure that your trip is perfect. Upon arrival we were greeted at the door, offered a drink of our choice (which we were not charged for) and given time to compose ourselves before being shown to the room. The room itself was fairly small (not too small), however I would definitely go along with the title of it being a 'cosy room'. The bathroom was equipped with everything you need and for the size of the room seemed somewhat spacious. The bed was very comfortable and the size of the room did not take away from the quality. The decor was modern and stylish and had everything that you would require for a relaxing stay. The cleanliness of the room was also emaculate with the maids doing a fantastic job on a daily basis. The hotel itself is situated just a 10 minute walk away from Gare Montpanasse and only a 2 minute walk from the nearest Metro 'Pernety'. From there it is extremely easy to navigate the Metro around Paris to get to all of the attractions. Aside from the excellence of the hotel itself, the staff in particular were impressive. They all spoke fluent English and were always on hand to provide help and advice. This hotel is simply fantastic and for its price cannot be beaten. We had no complaints during our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyFoodie420
Reviews.Content: It does not get much better then this. Alexander and the rest of the staff are amazing and clearly understand fine food as each restaurant was better then the next. Super friendly and easy to speak to as well. We stayed here for 5 days in the lowest price room and have not a single complaint. Nice area and a great value but don't expect the four seasons or you will be disappointed this is a first rate boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Beni80
Reviews.Content: We booked this place based on the great tripadvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. What a great find. This is the place to stay if you want to visit Paris and experience the Parisian life. Make sure you check the local surrounding restaurants. The reception is extremely helpful. We'll be back

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel a bit far from the attractions”
Reviews.Author: xxrxx27
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a weekend in Paris, and we were really not disappointed. We had contact with two guys in the reception and they were the nicest receptionists ever. They were both very friendly and helpful and made the start and end of our holiday very pleasant. Our room was on the second floor. It was a clean room, not very spacious, but I think it is normal for the Paris standards. The bed was comfortable, there was a small TV and also a minibar. They didnâ€™t charge us extra for the couple bottles of water we had. The bathroom was nice and clean as well but, they should actually change the soap, because it didnâ€™t smell nice at all. We generally enjoyed our stay and we would stay there again. The only problem is that the location of the hotel is a bit difficult if you go to Paris only for 2 days. There is a metro station in 10 minutes walking distance; however it doesnâ€™t take you directly to the most o the places you would need.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a real neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: starperson
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews and because we needed to be convenient to Gare Montparnese. It is about 10 blocks south. While not in the thick of things, the hotel is about 3 blocks from the metro along a lovely shopping street. The room was quite nice - not huge but not bad - with a very modern bathroom and nice appointments. The staff was very friendly and helpful and their English is much better than my French. The hotel included recommendations for restaurants. We tried two and both were very good. When we returned to Paris we stayed in a more usual area (the Rue Cler area) and I wished we had stayed at Le Fabe a second time. If you are going to take the metro anyway, this was the better hotel and a lovely little neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Room like a sauna”
Reviews.Author: ALF0308
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend break staying at Le Fabe. Our room was on the small side but was very clean. The hotel decor made everywhere appear very dark, especially in public areas. I had booked a Charme category room and was somewhat disappointed. We were right opposite the lift and had two fire doors out side the room as well. This meant we could hear the comings and goings of other guests at all times. My biggest criticism would be of the heating/air conditioning. The room was like a sauna, so we opened the window - which of course, let all of the traffic noise in. We put the air-conditioning on and within minutes were lying there with our teeth chattering! Other than that, yes the hotel is in a fabulous location and the staff were absolutely charming

Reviews.Title: “Very clean... close to Metro so easy to move around”
Reviews.Author: Mals909
Reviews.Content: Pernety metro is very close and quite easy to go to the center of Paris. Montparnasse train station is about a 10 minute walk . Grocery and laundry very close to the hotel and a number of eating places.Special thanks to Sacha for being so nice and helpful..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DerekWaterford
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived and were treated to complementary coffee until check out we could not have been made feel more welcome. The rooms are spacious for Paris, modern and clean. Staff are wonderful, helpful and friendly. Great area, plenty of cafes, restaurants and metro stops. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and will stay there again whenever we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel at 14a with sauna!”
Reviews.Author: Mikko H
Reviews.Content: We came from Reims to Paris to continue our honeymoon. We spent three nights at Le Fabe. From the first minute we felt especially welcomed as Alexandre invited us in with finnish language saying tervetuloa! (which means welcome). Alexandre was much more finnish than an average parisian as Le Fabe also has sauna downstairs, which we of course enjoyed one night after walking around city and having tired feet. In that kind of situation nothing helps better than sauna! I hope more people will take advantage of private sauna Le Fabe provides free of charge for their customers. If there wasnÂ´t sauna, I still would have rated Le Fabe as 5*. It is not in the utmost center of Paris, but city center is easily accessible from Pernety metro station which is quite close to Le Fabe. Neighborhood is really nice, having lots of small special shops and brasseries/bars nearby. This is different Paris compared to hoods next to Eiffel. We really enjoyed walking down the 14a streets feeling there was not any other tourists. We stayed at "French Romance", very nice room with complimentary champagne. Le Fabe offers breakfast for 10e, absolutely recommendable! Good variety of different choices. No wonder Le Fabe is located at top15 in Paris hotels. All the personnel is very friendly and staying here was a great pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff, 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Charles D
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancÃ©e stayed for five days in Paris and we were very pleased to stay in that hotel. ItÂ´s very well located, near stores, subway stations, restaurants and so on. Staff were wonderfull. Rooms were large, modern, well equiped and very clean. Breakfast was great. We have absolutely no complain at all about this hotel. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: MariaBai-Sheka81
Reviews.Content: If you are a person w great taste and very particular about where you stay, and would love to stay somewhere and feel perfectly as though you are in heaven and as well experience the beauty of paris and all it has to offer...Le fabe will truly complete your stay in paris. It has a wonderful atmosphere and ambience. I didnt want to leave...its a great place. The people are just wonderful and pleasant in everyway :). Too helpful and friendly i couldnt believe it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations and more”
Reviews.Author: Scobeaux
Reviews.Content: I was expecting to be pleased with our room because of the positive reviews, but Le Fabe turned out to be better than I had hoped. The staff was exceptionally pleasant and helpful. The room was small, as seems to be pretty standard in Paris, but was nicely decorated and efficiently laid out, and very clean. The shower was fine, with good pressure. The wifi worked without a hitch. The room was quiet (and I am extremely sensitive to noise). It is very close to the metro, and we ate at two splendid and reasonably-priced restaurants within a five-minute walk, recommended by the hotel concierge. My friends, who were staying nearby, were green with envy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter G
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for a few days in late August 2011. The Le Fabe Hotel is in a great central location, just a few minutes walk from the Metro and 10 minutes walk to Montparnasse Station. The room was very clean and reasonably modern, although a little on the small side (that's the only reason it didn't get an 'Excellent' rating). Since we didn't spend a lot of time in the room it didn't matter too much anyway. The staff were great, all spoke English and were more than helpful. Free wifi is included. There's plenty of restaurants within a short walk of the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel for 30th Birthday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: HoxycoDown
Reviews.Content: We stayed at le Fabe from 29th Sept to 2nd October. The trip advisor fabulous comments lived up the reality! The hotel room and shower was clean and modern. The hotel very easy to find and handy to the metro. The staff where knowledgable and very friendly. We were given refreshment upon on arrival. The staff directed us the best routes to sight see and had money off coupons for various attractions. The bed was amazingly comfy. I would recommend the hotel to couples. You get a feel for the real france, and there are various cafes and bistro's within walking distance that are reasonably priced and the food was delicious. We will be recommending this hotel to anyone we know is going to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “What a great honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: AZmli
Reviews.Content: From the 24th of August to 31st we stayed at Le Fabe and it was fantastic. The tripadvisor comments were the reason we stayed here and we're glad we booked with them. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and honest. When I mean honest they gave us an honest opinion of restaurants around the area so we ended up going to a restaurant down the way literally 2 minutes down the street which was great Les Caves Solignac which they believed was one of the best around and it was. Also we had originally booked a room that was a standard room. Upon seeing that we would be there for over a week we were upgraded for free plus we received a great handwritten card and champagne which was very thoughtful. Now in terms of location it is NOT that far from the station. We are in our mid twenties and the walk was maybe 3-5 minutes. Directions: Leave the hotel going left then take a left at the main road and just walk straight for about 1 min and there is the station. I read these other reviews talking about a long walk, unless you want to stay above the station you cant really get the much closer its really not that bad. Plus the location is decent, its a suburb so there are not very many tourists which is what we like an authenticate neighborhood. I am sure you will like staying here, its a great place.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for one night of our honeymoon on the strength of previous Tripadvisor reviews and I'm afraid it didn't live up to our expectations. First, when we arrived neither the safe nor the shower was in working order. Although the safe was subsequently repaired this happened too late for us to actually use it. The shower was not repaired at all (forcing us to improvise our own fix using a hair clip!) and we were given no explanation as to why. In addition, despite paying for one of the more expensive rooms breakfast was not included in the rate; in fairness, we should probably have checked this in advance but I have stayed in Paris numerous times in the past and never paid this much for a hotel which charged extra for breakfast. In addition, the room was far too nosiy: the windows are very poorly soundproofed and we were woken at 5am by the sound of traffic outside. There's also no air con so the room was very stuffy at night. I reported all of these complaints to the front desk on check out and asked that they be conveyed to management: however I have yet to receive any response or apology. The one thing I will say in mitigation is that the front desk staff are very friendly and helpful but they can't make up for a hotel that is overpriced for the level of service and comfort we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bilyur
Reviews.Content: Hi, stayed at La Fabe in Aug 2011. We deliberately wanted to be in the residential area away from the noise of the main tourist areas. We had a pleasure of experiencing a bit of real life in Paris and for that we are grateful. The staff was very accommodating, the room was nice, the breakfast was good. To keep it short, we had an amazing time in Paris and the hotel definitely helped to make it an enjoyable trip. Thanks a lot, La Fabe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: 159ecsmith
Reviews.Content: Excellent find! Very welcoming, nothing was too much trouble. Knowledge of local transport was very useful, even gave us free metro tickets. Breakfast good value for money. Would certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Friendliness”
Reviews.Author: CLBUSA
Reviews.Content: A warm, friendly welcome at a clean modern hotel. Staff were incredibly helpful, polite and knowledgeable making perfect recommendations for our party mix. Would absolute return and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for real Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: mafgea2011
Reviews.Content: I loved Le Fabe! My boyfriend and I stayed in a Cosy Room in early August for 5 nights. As soon as we arrived we felt welcome, being offered a drink and seat after a long flight to Paris arriving late at night - nothing like a hot chocolate to send me into a happy sleep! Although the room was small, it is clean and comfortable with a surprisingly spacious bathroom. Most importantly it had a great shower - always nice to come back to after a full day of exploring! We both had a great time in Paris which was a great start to a 6 week adventure around Europe. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. It is not in the centre of Paris but within a two minute walk we found everything we needed for us to feel we experienced "real" Paris without such a touristic feel. There was a laundromat on the same street, and around the corner everything else - e.g., frommagerie, boulangerie, supermarket. The staff in the hotel were all very helpful. We had breakfast in the hotel once and it had a great selection - hard boiled eggs (being kept warm!), fruit, cheese and meats, cereal, yoghurt, pastries, coffee. However, the boulangeries around the corner always had a good selection of goodies for brekkie which we opted for most of the time. We had brought food back with us to make lunch several times and the staff were only too happy to provide us with plates, utensils and anything else we required. It was nice little touches like this that made the stay even more enjoyable. Thanks to Le Fabe for giving us a fantastic start to our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Le Fabe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hannah M
Reviews.Content: Welcoming environment. Clean and nice room. Friendly and helpful staff. Hotel very close to metro and stores. We had a great time. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: duffcake
Reviews.Content: Went away for our wedding anniversary. Excellent service. Staff were great - warm, friendly and extremely helpful. Stayed in a 'cosy' room option which was on the small side but by no means pokey. Bathroom was a good size while the room itself was clean and airy with nice decor. A very useful guide to restaurants in the area is also provided in your room (Taster menu at La Cantine du Troquet nearby is well worth trying!) Sauna facilities, while simple, were a welcome plus for a hotel of this size. Location is good, away from the tourist spots but with easy access to the centre of Paris (20 mins or so on the metro which is a short walk away). A couple of places en route from the metro station provide good spots for breakfast or a nightcap!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon at Le Fabulous Le Fabe!!”
Reviews.Author: LouWilsonLee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5th to 7th September for our honeymoon and we had a fabulous time! From the minute we arrived the staff here were kind and helpful. We were given a seat and a drink as soon as we arrived and the guy (I'm dorry we didn't get his name!) showed us a map of Paris and gave us some hints and tips for our stay. He then took us up to our room - we stayed in the Primevera room - it is clean, modern and warm and best of all they left us a lovely little note and a bottle of champagne!!! Oh and the bed is super comfortable! The staff are really helpful and friendly in this hotel and they make you feel at home. We loved that we could get a cup of coffee when we came back late at night! The coffee was the best we had in Paris! The night receptionist was very welcoming and friendly too. The hotel is very generous and all these little gestures really do add up to a very special stay - when we were waiting for our shuttle bus back to the airport we were given a plate full of pastries and a drink..! We did not have breakfast at the hotel but looking back I wish we had as its great value - its 10 Euros each and there are alot of pastries and cereal and coffee. You pay this in a local cafe for alot less. We absolutely recommend this hotel. Great location, gorgeous hotel, clean. friendly and great value. Thankyou Le Fabulous Le Fabe!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this new and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: jess h
Reviews.Content: Great service from all of the 4 guys that work here. Always willing to help with anything (especially directions). Nice new extremely clean hotel. We were greeted after a long journey with a drink and a seat before being shown to our room. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: KristyOB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Le Fabe for 3 nights. I have to say it was excellent. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, they went out of their way to make our trip to Paris unforgettable! The location was perfect for us, as it wasn't in the middle of a busy tourist area so we were able to experience Paris surrounded by locals rather than tourists. At the same time it was only a few stops away on the metro (v. easy & cheap to use) from all of the attractions. There are plenty of cafe, bars, good restaurants and lovely bakeries around in close walking distance. The hotel was very clean & comfortable, and our room was a decent size for a Paris hotel room. I would highly recommend a stay at Le Fabe!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Dany K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Fabe for 4 wonderful days. The welcome of the staff was warm and welcoming with a cup of coffee while the room is been made. The room we stayed (named "Together") was very good, clean with a window to the street and very welcoming. The hotel was very quite during the day and nights and we could sleep quietly. We used one day the nice and well organized sauna which was operated only for us. Next time we will be in Paris, La FAbe will for sure be our first choice. To Alexander and the staff, thanks for the lovely time.

Reviews.Title: “Le Fabe is Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: bwalker1
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel which offers well run, comfortable and modern accommodation at a budget price. Although not in the very heart of Paris the metro was only a few minutes walk and it was then only 15 - 20 minutes to the main attractions of Paris whilst still being able to return to the tranquility of Pernety to sleep. There are plenty of restaurants, cafes and bars in the area if you want to stay close to home but just as easy to hop back into town for dinner. There was a very good patisserie around the corner, a convenience store and we loved walking past the butchers and the fish shop in the morning to admire the beautiful display of goods. We found the room to be immaculately clean and a good size for Paris. All the staff were very helpful and polite with English so excellent, I saved my school girl french for out and about town. To Alexandre and team. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: conygar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in July. We were aware of the location and did not find it a problem. 5 minutes walk to Pernety metro station and then about ten minutes on line 13 and you are on the Champs Elysee. The room was fairly small and sparsely furnished. There was a bed, a small bedside table one side and a two tier glass table the other with a Tassimo machine and cups. A very small glass table on wonky legs no bigger than a shelf which was supposed to be a dressing table. a little stool also glass/perspex , no padding. No mirror above this table.One other dining type chair. Lighting not brilliant. Wardrobe space very limited and only two small shelves, no chest of drawers. Bathroom was good, although more use could have been made of space under basin, shelves or cupboards would be useful. Towels were very poor quality and bath towels were quite small. Limited toiletries. The room and bathroom were very clean. All room doors are very close to each other and consequently you hear them banging. All the staff were pleasant, spoke English and were very helpful with our queries. Did not take breakfast as we thought it expensive. All in all an O.K. hotel , but for money we paid, ( Â£150.00 per night ) we would would have expected more amenities as mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with first class customer service”
Reviews.Author: Glendoliver
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short 2 night stay at this hotel absolutely fantastic cannot praise it enough. The thing that made this hotel were the staff who were so helpful and friendly. Upon arrival we were invited to take a seat and relax whilst the receptionist prepared us a drink and the proceeded to check us in whilst we relaxed. As it was our first time in Paris we didnt have much of a clue but the staff at the hotel were so helpful and sat down with us for a considerable time helping us understand the Metro an also giving us hotel recommendations. The hotel itself is small but the rooms are exceptionally large for a city centre hotel in my opinion. Our room was immaculately cleaned, the bed was comfortable and the water hot! The hotel offer parking for 15 Euros a night which for Paris I found to be very competitive. This is at a secure underground car park which is about 1 minutes walk from the hotel so I would also recommend this if you're driving. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast for 10 Euros per person which again for Paris is very reasonable. There was a selection of pastries, toast, cereal, fruit, ham, cheese hot drinks and juice which were all well stocked and replenished if running low. The only thing I would say is that the hotel is located a bit away from the centre but this we found to be a positive as we didn't really want to stay in the midst of the huddle and bussle of Paris. The neighbourhood where the hotel is located is relatively quiet but there was a large selection of local coffee shops and patisseries. I am struggling to find anything negative to say about the hotel we have both said we want to go back to Paris and we will definitely be stay at Le Fabe it offered a great personal service and was a lovely, clean and modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly unique hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Sjprecious
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Paris and we loved this hotel!! It's small enough to get personal service. We asked lots of questions about getting around, and everyone was so helpful. Great breakfasts. Loved our room too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy comfortable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcofsky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Fabe at the end of June. We stayed in the Mona Lisa room. The decor of the hotel is very fun and the room was clean and comfortable! Le Fabe is located in a quiet neighborhood, but close to many restaurants. The metro is about 5 minutes away and is on the same line as many popular tourist spots. Alex was beyond helpful and offered many tips for getting around the city. I also enjoyed the toilet paper print wallpaper in the bathroom,clever! This hotel is a great value and a lovely place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, close to metro though two stops from Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: svimes
Reviews.Content: Nice feel to hotel, close to Pernerty metro or about 10 mins from Gare Montparnasse. Smallish rooms, nice staff. Sachet drinks machines in rooms, free wi fi. Limited toiletries in bathroom though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & friendly hotel away from Tourist Hub”
Reviews.Author: Jhulz
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Le Fabe hotel was An absolute pleasure. From the moment we entered we were greeted by Adrian who offered us a drink while the room was sorted. Although in a slightly less touristy area, the value for money, hospitality an quality of the room more than compensated. It is still very close to the metro. Would recommend to anyone wanting a traditional French experience.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel in a charming area...away from tourist trap areas!”
Reviews.Author: londonnzgirl
Reviews.Content: Found this little gem for a stay in OCt last year (apologies for tardy review). I love a boutique hotel, especially one that is as clean and fresh as this. Recent renovations are tres chic. Only a couple of minutes walk fro the metro station which is a big plus, and nearby is a GORGEouS restaurant that we loved so much we went two nights in a row. Can't remember the name but it's almost next door, and has no menu apart froma blackboard listing their daily offerings (all in French but their lovely staff helped us) so you must go there-early as they don't take bookings and the locals spill out onto the street late at night waiting for tables. Back to the hotel, they will deliver breakfast to your room and at only about â‚¬8 it was enough for me and the boy to share. It's a bit out of the way from tourist areas, but if you like getting away from the tourist trap area and you wnt to experience a real Parisian suburb, cant recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value no complaints”
Reviews.Author: jww7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights and found the hotel very satisfactory and very good value. We hope to go again. It is abit out of the way but there are several good restaurants nearby. The reception staff are very helpful and will advise on most things one would want to know.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: bearloyer
Reviews.Content: my partner and I were on holiday in Paris and loved this boutique hotel. Yes, the room was small, but the service and amenities all but made up for that. Close to the metro stop with a very helpful staff. Great patissieries and restaurants nearby in this non-touristy area

Reviews.Title: “really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bishopcreek
Reviews.Content: we stayed here two nights recently on the way back from three weeks in Turkey. We usually rent an apartment when we visit Paris but because of the short stay we tried this hotel and would certainly stay there again. This was the first time we have stayed in the 14th arr. and we were very pleased with the hotel and the area. Le Fabe is a 3 year old hotel that is contemporary in design. The room was the typical size of a european hotel but the layout was so good that it did not feel small to us. The bed was comfortable and the lighting was good. The staff was great, they had lots of good recommendations for meals and were very friendly and helpful in everything we asked. The area is not very touristy which we liked a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: lupy_mt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 week in Le Fabe this June and we are entirely pleased with our time in this hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful during our stay and went out of their way to accommodate us. The staff made us feel welcome there. My wife and I travel a lot, and we know the markings of a good hotel when we stay in one. They gave us great advice on how to best get around Paris to avoid a hassle and where to find the spots we needed to get to easily. The room was impeccably clean and well-appointed for our needs (the bathroom in our room was huge, and the housekeeping did a great job of keeping everything spotless).It's located in a nice neighborhood close to a convenient metro line- so you're just a short walk around the block to the metro to get anywhere you want to be in Paris quickly. The price was very reasonable and we feel like we got great value for our money here. We will absolutely be staying here again the next time we come to Paris. Thank you Le Fabe!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & great staff”
Reviews.Author: TheNavajo
Reviews.Content: Finding our way to the hotel from Orly airport was a little tricky as we decided to use the underground and there were many changes, we ended up giving up and hopping in a cab. There is apparently a bus that goes straight from this airport, and an equivelant from the other airports, that takes around 45mins and costs around 17 euros that takes you almost directly to the hotel, which would have been more convenient for us with our heavy cases. We usually have a lower budget for hotels when we travel as we don't often spend too much time in them, but as this was the infamous City of Love we decided to spend that little bit extra for something a bit special. The hotel was beautifully decorated and our room was the Orchid on the third floor. We found it a little smaller than expected but perfectly equipped with all the standard things you'd expect such as mini fridge etc but also a safe which we found useful. We were suprised at no pay-per-views on the TV but when we mentioned this to the concierge he said they were being replaced next week for this very reason. There was a basement sauna available free of charge but we didn't use it, we did however use their computer and internet in the basement and although this ran slowly it was adequete, you need to ask for a password at reception. The morning breakfast was great value for money as it was a 10 euro buffet which was good value in contrast with what was available at all restaurants and cafes we found in the area. Room service only had drinks and we felt that even basic food items would have been desirable. However, the real star quality about this hotel is their wonderful concierge Alex. He was consistently helpful and welcoming, gave us lots of help with directions and even advised us where to go on our second day, a real winner as we were undecided and it ended up being the highlight of the trip. His English was exceptional as was his high level of customer service and attention. I would recommed going to this hotel simply on the basis that the staff were outstanding, the bedrooms were scrupulously changed everyday and if you're not familiar with Paris then it's a real comfort to know you have a native speaker looking out for you with genuine concern. We look forward to seeing Alex again, and have given him details to visit us in Manchester should he ever be in England!

Reviews.Title: “Meet our expectation and provided a comfortable base to explore the city from”
Reviews.Author: ChhayaNPaul
Reviews.Content: Our review has been a bit too long overdue, but what couldnâ€™t have changed is the location of the place. The staff was very helpful over calls and emails and guiding us with local info about Paris when we landed there. This hotel is not walking distance to any of the major attractions of Paris â€“ The Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Lido, Notre Dame, etc. but it takes under 30 mins to get to them with the fantastically well planned Paris Metro. The closest metro station (Pernety) is literally 2 mins walk from the hotel and easy to find. The room was (is suppose it still is) modern, spotless (clean) and cozy. There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are some decent restaurants and takeaways in the vicinity where we ate/ ordered from. Itâ€™s comforting to have a pharmacy just across the street J. Would definitely stay there, when we visit Paris again! In fact we recommended to friends in late Sep, who did stay there and loved it. Our Profile: We are a young urban Indian couple married less than 5 years with no kids. We are not backpackers and like to indulge. In India we often stay at 5 star properties to play it safe on - cleanliness, staff attitude, physical security & room comfort â€“ by all these measures this place surely meet our expectation and provided a comfortable base to explore the city from. This detail is just to put our review in perspective.

Reviews.Title: “funky little place”
Reviews.Author: jportrx3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, sharing with a friend. The staff were fantastic, and all spoke fantastic english, which was a great help as it was my first time to France. I appreciated the staff letting my friend having access to the room before i arrived in Paris, as many hotels would not allow this given the cost was initially being charged to me. The room was very nice and really funky decked out in a Mona Lisa theme. The only issue i have, which is small, is the location of the hotel appeared to be on the fringe of Paris, however well located to subways. It was easy to hear noise from neighbouring rooms, but my friend and i thought it was quite humurous! Free internet access was a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AKtravel83
Reviews.Content: So glad that we found Le Fabe. The hotel a short walk to the Pernety metro which takes you to all the major attractions all less than 10 minutes away. We had a very warm welcome and the staff were all very friendly. Very clean and comfortable rooms and we would definitely stay here again if we returned to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “So good we've booked up for another visit...”
Reviews.Author: haunjmf
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to Paris for her birthday in April 2011 and as usual, I looked on Trip Advisor for value - seeking something in the top 20, but not breaking the bank. I went for Le Fabe based on a combination of the reviews and it being Â£200 less than two hotels also in the top 20, but which were located nearer to the Eiffel Tower. I was delighted with Le Fabe. I emailed after booking, to request a room with a bath - no problem. Upon arrival, we were offered (and accepted) a coffee while our luggage was taken to the room, which was the Mona Lisa, on the top floor. It was excellent - spotlessly clean; attractive interior decoration; fairly roomy; window opening onto the street; plenty wardobe space; and a lovely big bathroom with shower / bath combo. The staff were really helpful, throughout, particuarly when we needed travel advice, or something to be printed. Not overwhelming - just right. It's located quite close to the Pernety Metro stop, which is close to Montparnasse. The surrounding area contains little shops, restaurants and bars and has a row of Paris Bikes nearby. In short, it is a great little hotel; so good that we are going back at the end of July - and I am really looking forward to it. This time I booked a Plaiser room, at the upfront rate (which appears to be the best deal). Oh, one thing - the English TV channels didn't work at the time (apologies were received), but the internet did.

Reviews.Title: “much more than just a place to sleep and shower.”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust987
Reviews.Content: ever wondered what it would be like to book a seemingly promising hotel online and then not feeling slightly disappointed upon actually checking in? i don't remember there being a single time in my life that i have willingly paid a hotel bill at check-out. seriously, not once did i have to cringe at dusty picture frames, shabby business centers, or regret not bringing flipflops upon seeing the shower. it is unheard of that i would be void of filing a single complaint. i'm still surprised at how much this hotel actually enhanced our overall experience of paris. let's put it this way: after staying here for 3 nights, i am actually putting in the effort to log into expedia and write out this review because i feel this establishment deserves to be properly recognized. all 3 nights = excellent. i travel often and never without consulting tripadvisor, i insist you book here. my travels have been frequent, obsessively planned, well financed and across several countries. even the wallet draining rooms at The Cove at atlantis bahamas is a weak contender against the integrity of this place. seriously, it is simply done right. in a world where 95% of resorts and hotels tend to fall short off expectations in at least 2 areas, this place is in the 5% that does not. all areas covered. well financed. efficiently managed. most important: this hotel clearly values quality over budget. by far the best interior design i have encountered, obviously the result of a competent designer and a generous budget. there can be no comparison or complaint. very clean. very. high quality bedsheets. extremely comfortable bed. fantastic fantastic fantastic interior design. --> nice lighting. gorgeous winding staircase. great wallpaper. pleasant room carpeting. --> GREAT BATHROOMS. staff and service went above and beyond my expectations. close to the metro. very nice neighborhood. a multitude of shops. my boyfriend got stomach poisoning one night. the staff did literally everything short of performing Christ-like healing miracles. they arranged for a doctor to come to US. offered a new room so that we didn't have to risk any further contamination. & called the room/my cellphone periodically to ask if he was feeling better. seriously. go here. i'm a new yorker, an aesthetics snob and a woman with an irrational fear of germs. not once did i feel the need to wear socks in the room or flipflops in the shower. superb.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: bigtraveler2000
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at this hotel based on the information from Trip Advisor. Paris trip was a birthday present for my husband. Before our travel I contacted le fabe a few times asking different questions. They always gave me all the answers very quickly. We do not like hotels at the most touristic areas and we prefer to experience more local life. The location of the hotel was perfect: not central, very quiet, but very easy to get to all touristic attractions. We arrived to Orly airport and it was very easy to get to the hotel with Air France shuttle bus. We walked to the hotel from Gare Montparnasse bus stop. It took us max 10 min. The Metro in Paris works very well and it is very easy to get to different places from Le fabe. At our first day we actually walked from the hotel to The Jardin du Luxembourg, then to Latin quarter, Notre dame, Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es, Eiffel Tower and back to the hotel. It was a wonderful walking trip (7 hours). We got the room called â€œTogetherâ€� at the 2nd flour. The room was very beautiful and clean. It was enough space there. The bathroom was very convenient and clean too (we found towels too small, but maybe it it ususal in Paris...I do not know...). Air condition worked properly all the time. Only one English Tv channel worked at the time of our stay (but we were not very interesting in watching TV). Hotel has free WIFI which worked properly all the time. We did not have breakfast at the hotel because we like to eat at some local places (there are plenty of bakeries at the area around the hotel). There are also some very good restaurants at the area (hotel staff always gave us advices and called for us to make a reservation if needed). I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would advice it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms, great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: rustyblade
Reviews.Content: Alex and his staff at Le Fabe are wonderful. They did erevything they could, which incuded having our room ready early for us (9am) after our long flight from Sydney. The hotel itself is divine, the room and bathroom spotlessly clean. The coffee machine in our room got a workout, & was a great bonus (not just a kettle). The location is unreal. Everything is within a 2 minute walk. Bakery, cafes, fresh fruit shops, supermarkets, restaurants and the Pernety metro station. Being near a metro, getting anywhere in Paris is a 5-10min metro trip. Getting there from the airport is a breeze using the hotel's directions. We loved our 5 night stay and will stay at Le Fabe everytime we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: live4art
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at Le Fabe. Rooms are small but so very unique and clean. We were awakened by drunken portugese honeymooners above us stomping and slamming things. The night clerk was extremely helpful trying to make him understand that he was waking the whole building and then it was quiet. You can hear people in the hallway but they were kind to whisper. Some partiers were yelling in the ally in the morn and again the night clerk went out there and chased them off! The clerks (Adrian for day shift I think) went above and beyond for us. The metro station is a few blocks down and we had good food at the "au metro" cafe right at the metro entrance.. With football game and many locals it was a tres french experience for us. A pharmace directly xcross from hotel came in very handy. Altogether, a neat hotel but an old building where you do hear others who can't be respectful. With good people, the room inside, however, was very quiet like like a cool quite cacooon on a warm Paris night.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: mcevoyjs
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about Le Fabe. On our arrival we were instantly welcomed, our bags were taken, and we were given a much-needed coffee. We were then informed that our room had been upgraded at no extra cost to us, because we were staying for a bit longer than the usual weekend away. The room was so comgortable, with a lovely bed, and a huge ensuite you could play 5-a-side in! It's close to the metro, which is the only way to get around Paris anyway. We always grabbed a coffee and pastry on our way there and ate breakfast on the go to our next gallery/museum/whatever. We were made feel so welcome there, even when arriving back late at night. I would recommend it to anybody who is going away to Paris, and if we ever go back again, it's where we shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: GwynJones
Reviews.Content: This is a truly great place, situated in a vibrant, genuinely Parisian area, not in a tourist trap. Even so, Pernety Metro station is close by: so access to central Paris is quick and easy. The hotel is beautifully furnished; its staff are incredibly helpful and are prepared to recommend good places to eat nearby, of which there are plenty. Les Caves de Solignac restaurant - 2 minutes walk from the hotel - is particularly good, and good value to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: gjchan
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, considering you're in Paris! While it's not in the center, the nearest metro stop is just 2 blocks away, and is really quite accessible. We were upgraded to the biggest room on our 2nd stay (we went to Rome in between 2 set of days in Paris) and they allowed us to leave 1 of our luggages behind as we went to Rome. The staff is incredibly nice and spoke fantastic English! They debunked all notions we had about French rudeness, because they're not only very helpful, they really go out of their way to help you out. The breakfast is also quite tasty, with the yogurt being my favorite. Stay here for as long as you dont mind not being in the center of Paris. Besides, Montparnasse is a great Parisian neighborhood, allowing you to see and experience Parisian local life, w/o all the tourist traps :)

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: zaplady12
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean & bright. Bathrooms were spotless. Staff very friendly and went out of there way to make you feel at home & comfortable. Hotel had a lovely breakfast/coffee room in lobby. Breakfast 10 E. Coffee 1 E. Within walking distance to Gare Montparnesse. We took Air France bus to Gare Montparnesse and walked to hotel from there. about 10 min. Cost was reasonalbe for the area and type of hotel. I would definitely stay here again. Hotel was very quiet. We did not hear any street noise or noise from other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cost small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Littlelamb817
Reviews.Content: Very new fitting out inside the room. Close to the station. Extremely tidy & clean hotel. Staff is very helpful, especially the hotel manager (who can speak fluent English). If u do not mind the size of hotel room, this would be a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very clean.....very small.”
Reviews.Author: Nicky F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Fabe hotel for 2 nights in january, we arrived in paris via the eurostar but it was very easy to reach the hotel using the metro, Le Fabe is situated just a few minutes away from the pernerty metro station. The hotel is very well decorated and cozy but very very small, yes its a boutique hotel but its also the smallest ive ever stayed at. The staff were very pleasant and helpful with anything you needed, i used the free wi fi which had a great connection. I thought the hotel was in a nice quiet neighbourhood away from the hustle and bustle. I couldnt comment on the food here as we ate out in the mornings. All in all its a nice place but a bit on the small side, just one thing though.... give the chinese restraunt down the road a miss as its terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey hotel off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: AnnieH04
Reviews.Content: I booked la fabe from the reviews on trip advisor however after my stay I felt that it was too expensive for what it offered. We paid 450 euros for 3 nights and whilst the room was small (but as expected for Paris) the location was disappointing. Although by Pernete metro it felt a long way from the centre of Paris and far from the bustling Monparnesse centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: magneticman_uk
Reviews.Content: Most other reviewers have covered everything that needs to be said about Le Fabe Hotel. Our highlights were the attentive staff who were there to help at all times. Our room was small but more than functional and very clean. We had problems with an intermittent Wi-Fi connection on the 2nd Floor and even with a cable it was still intermittent. Hardly a huge problem though. We decided to have breakfast in the hotel at 10 Euros each. To eat out locally could cost you 8.70 Euros for a coffee and a croissant. This made the hotel breakfast seem good value. There was the usual selection of fresh fruit, cereals, croissants, meats, cheeses etc. to choose from. There appeared to be all the shops, cafe's and restaurants locally to give you plenty of choice and at not too expensive prices, considering the current exchange rate. We chose to eat in a little Chinese place very near the Metro station for around 8 or 9 Euros each for 2 courses. Very reasonable. On another night, we had a delicious meal at a Japanese restaurant for around 12 Euro's each. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. Don't be put off by comments about the location on the Metro line. We used the Metro to get around quite a lot and it was no inconvenience to have to go on another couple of stops on the M13 line to the hotel and it was nice to be situated in a slightly quieter area. The walls are fairly thin at Le Fabe but we had fire doors just outside our room closed at night time which helped reduce any noises from the stairs and other rooms and we had undisturbed sleeps in a very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: tarryn222
Reviews.Content: I stayed in le fabe hotel in paris for 2 nights, then went to dordogne for 4 nights and then another night on my return. Their service was really great. They allowed us to keep our spare luggage with them while we were away. Because my plane only left at 11pm they kept my luggage for me after I checked out, and after spending the day walking around paris they welcomed me to have a shower and sauna before I left for the airport. The rooms are quite big buy paris standards. Their cnn channel wasn't working so couldn't watch will and kate's wedding. Beds comfy, room dark, bathroom nice. Only prob is there was noise from the next door building on saturday night, and the walls are a little bit thin. The neighbourhood is very suburban and not very central. But this was fine by me. Went for a run in a nice park a few blocks away. Overall a really good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience! Honeymoon in Paris!! :)”
Reviews.Author: alice1705
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful & friendly!! The room & bathroom were a bit small but what can you expect for Paris. The room was very clean & cozy. Its also remodeled. The breakfast was perfect & delicious. It was a light breakfast but great! My honeymoon in Paris was great & Alex & Andres were very nice & were extremely informative. They even had a bottle of Champagne waiting for us with a note. Very sweet!! In Paris you need to take the metro to get around so the Hotel is very close to the Penerty metro stop. Very convenient!! I woud definitely recommend this hotel to family & friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent personalised service in very comfortable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: pk_kaufman
Reviews.Content: 5 of us travelling together - we booked 3 rooms in this lovely hotel and they were all very well appointed and for Paris, quite roomy. Plenty of room for bags and good hanging space. very good bathroom too. Montparnasse is a gorgeous area and featured heavily in literary, art and cultural life. The best part of it is the excellent host Alexander, a whiz at many languages who is very proud of his city and would pore over maps with us and send us to his favourite spots with many alternative routes. We had all been to Paris before and never had such good advice before. If we asked a question and he did not know the answer immediately, he would find out very quickly and would call around if need be. The restaurants he recommended were exactly what we asked for. The breakfast at the hotel is worth considering, good pastries, juices, yoghurts, cheeses, cold meats etc and it is available until about 12 - another plus, so you can actually go for a walk first. There is a mini coffee-maker in the room too.

Reviews.Title: “Small room and the Metro station is not on one of the main lines”
Reviews.Author: ToffeeTour
Reviews.Content: The staff were amazingly helpful, and they went out of the way to make things easy for us. However, the Hotel located in the Montparnasse area is not really convenient for sight-seeing. The nearest Metro station - Pernety - is 5 minutes away by walk, but it is not on one of the main Metro lines, which means that we had to change 2 lines to come in from the Gare de Lyon, and 3 lines to go the Charles de Gaulle Airport. On the 1 day, we were at the Hotel, we visited the Chateau de Versailles, and it we took the SNCF train from the Gare Montparnasse, which is a 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The rooms are tiny, and we had to jump over our bags to walk around. Wireless Internet did not work on the 2nd floor, and although the staff tried to help us by giving a cable connection, it did not work. The staff were very friendly though, and if we do go back to this Hotel again, it would be for that reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice for 3 star hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ddTrip76
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the hotel very much. It offers many standards that other three star hotels don't. It is definately a hotel that should be considered for a short trip to Paris. The highlights for us: - clean room, bathroom and hotel in general - very friendly and helpful staff - new hotel, modern design and elegant bathroom - free Wifi - location close to metro station Could be improved/criticized: - small size of the Cosy-room - limited number of englisch TV channels (only 3) - thin walls / no good noise isolation to the corridor

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dunzi
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect stay in Paris due to the fact that we chose Le Fabe Hotel. Everything was as expected from the Website and the pictures. The staff is very friendly and helps with lots of information. The rooms are small, nice and clean and the bathroom is modern and clean as well. We enjoyed our trip to Paris and we enjoyed staying in this hotel very much. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Lots of choices, good coffee and fruits as well as everything else you need for a breakfast. Location is nice, short walk to Metro station Pernety.

Reviews.Title: “no wonder the Mona Lisa is smiling...”
Reviews.Author: 1-sentence-reviewer
Reviews.Content: Le Fabe is indeed rather fabulous in an effortless-back-streets-of-Montparnasse kind of way; no wonder the Mona Lisa is smiling (in room 334 - go and find out for yourself :) ).

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, freindly, helpful, stylish and funky decor... highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Sammyboy217
Reviews.Content: Unnassuming from the outside - but stylish and funky decor within. The staff were helpful and approachable throughout our stay. The photos on the webiste of this hotel give an accurate reflection of the hotel - there is an attention to detail that i have not previously experienced. the hotel feels small and intimate, as was the room we stayed in - however it paradoxically had a feeling of space (re gorgeous french doors in our bedroom and bathroom) and sense of calmness (re thoughtful decor throughout the hotel). Near a metro station, in a relatively quiet area. lots of restaurants, at least 2 supermarkets and a post office nearby. Re the previous reviewers comment about it being a bit of a treck to the sites - yes i would agree - but Paris is enormous, and travelling (on the reliable metro line) is inevitable where ever you stay. the next time we go to Paris we hope to return to this hotel - I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: chris_alex_aus
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Le Fabe Hotel in January 2011. We chose La Fabe after transferring from another hotel in Paris and it was fantastic. The staff were absolutely lovely, so welcoming and spoke perfect english! The hotel is beautiful, modern, impeccably clean and beautifully decorated rooms. Bathrooms were also fantastic. The business centre downstairs was also fantastic as we weren't travelling with a laptop! Unfortunately I became ill during our stay after eating out one night and had to go to hospital - the staff were amazing, arranging our lift to the hospital and so understanding when my partner returned the next day to collect the bags! We'd reccommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “A Parisian Delight”
Reviews.Author: drtolliver
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect because friends & family who had been to Paris had not heard of LeFabe. What a wonderful delight it turned out to be. The staff was warm, welcoming & very helpful. The room lovely & spacious by European standards. And the shower was incredible! This was a short 2 day stop over for us but we hope to get back to Paris and would definately stay at LeFabe again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: westmids1972
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here with my partner , chose the hotel through reviews from trip advisor, glad I did, excellent staff, when we arrived we were offered a free upgrade because we were the first guests to arrive declined though as our aims were to see as much as Paris as possible and we thought someone else might appreciate it, offered complimentary drink while our paper work was sorted out, room was clean and comfortable and stylish , one small thing no English channels apart from BBC world news and CNN , so not much to watch when chilling out after a long day's sight seeing , but if thats the only issue then well you have nothing to worry about. A little out of the way from the main tourist area but that means it quiet , but it's easy to get around by walking or metro (pernety). Breakfast an extra 10euro , we declined but there was a good selection from what i saw , there is an excellent boulangerie just down the street ( walk out the entrance and go down the hill towards train line there is a small supermarket on other side of road turn right at end of road and there it is, no more than 2 mins walk in total) if you fancy pastry instead. Hotel is easy to get to from CDG take the air france cars bus no 4 to gare montparnasse 16.50euro but way cheaper than a taxi which is estimated between 35-80 euros!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: terrywphil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Le Fabe Hotel in June of 2010. We found a great hotel and staff that really helped make our stay in Paris great. As are most Paris hotels, the rooms are small, however, the amenities we great. We enjoyed the close proximity to the Metro and really liked the restaurants near the hotel.
