The restaurants nearby were really great. Ask for a list at the desk.. Don't expect to translate the menu's though! We were luck enough to find someone that we could speak with to help us order food. Stay at the Le Fabe. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: ftill123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I got back from Paris yesterday, having stayed in this hotel for two nights. I booked the hotel from the other reviews on this website, and I'm glad I did! What anyone else has said about it being 'too far' from central Paris is not true, it too us 10 minutes to get to the Champs Elysee. The staff at the hotel were very nice and upgraded our room for free, let us check in early and gave us advice about where to go and little tips that aren't in the guide books. (Don't worry about the star rating, it really is much nicer than 3*s)

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LeoCPH
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay in this hotel. I arrived late in the evening and the staff was very welcoming and helpful, just what I needed after long day of travelling. The room was fantastic with free wireless which is rare for hotel in Paris. The breakfast was simple but the quality was good. I have stayed at many hotels in Paris - big chain and small independent hotels. So far, this is the best stay for me in that city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little boutique hotel at this price”
Reviews.Author: carolynebrown
Reviews.Content: Everyone has already said what a great little find Le Fabe is. The staff are friendly, the rooms modern and well-equipped (everything works). You can hear other people opening wardrobes etc in other rooms but I slept soundly each night and it is on a quiet street. The local restaurant La Cantine du Troquet served high quality dishes and had a decent wine list. A nice surprise was the Henri Cartier Bresson Foundation gallery just five mins walk away. Only gripe would be getting to and from the hotel but I guess that depends where you are getting to and coming from. It's only two blocks from a metro station ... just seemed like I always chose places that needed you to travel on three lines.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: scottfreetracey
Reviews.Content: Our room 'Silk and Drops' had a full bathroom. This was great for a nice long soak after a long day out and about in Paris. Its situated in a lovely lively district with nice little shops and a few nice places to eat. Its a very short walk to the metro which will take you straight to all the attractions. Staff were fab and friendly but could have done with some where to store our luggage a little better in the room.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: baron1973
Reviews.Content: stayed there last weekend this is a lovely little hotel the rooms are lovely but a little small but you don't mind as its different. Alexander at reception very freindly.The buisness centre in the basement and the sauna all free of charge are nice little touches.all in all a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, fantastic service!!”
Reviews.Author: Wheelho
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel going from the reviews on here, and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel isn't too far out, at the Pernety stop on the M13 and about 25 mins from Champs de Elysee on the same metro line. From Gare Du Nord, you need to to take the M4 towards Porte D'orleans, off at Monteparnasse Bienvenue and jump on the M13 towards Chatillon and your there. The rooms were very clean, a good size, especially for Paris, and a nice bathroom! The staff were extremely helpful and very welcoming! A credit to the trade!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED HOTEL! Also for good food, Au Metro next to the Pernety stop is good value for food, but we found a lovely little restaurants called Les Artiste on Rue Didot. Fantastic little french restaurant, which I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HowieBoldon
Reviews.Content: I booked for 6 nights after much research on Trip Advisor.I can confirm all of the good reportsand the helpful and friendly staff have to be see to be believed.We had booked for a Cosy room but as we were staying for more than a few days we were upgraded to a larger ground floor room.This was very good ,well decorated and a nice size with adequate storage,a good bed and linen and the bathroom was huge with a "wet room" shower area.I believe this was the disabled access room .The only disadvantage is that you have no opening window and you are very close to the breakfast area.You may need earplugs to get you through the breakfast set up time (not deafening but noticable) but I always use earplugs in French Hotels anyway.The other guests were either very quiet or got up later then us as we had no noise from them.The local area is great with many restaurants and bars clustered around the Metro station.I think there was a choice of 3 cake shops from which to select you evening cake.You have to do somthing in the 30 minutes while the Sauna heats up ! We used "Pizza Pernety"which is over the road to the Pernety metro stop and has been in business since 1990.Full of locals and fully recommended .We also used the Chinese Imperial City (the one with the stone dragons outside) which was probably the best value meal I had in Paris and the COUS COUS Chez Berbert which the front desk recommended and is near the base of the Tower beside the entrance to the shopping centre.This was very enjoyable and you want to go early before the que forms as it is very popular.The business centre in the basement also provided a small seating area and the Sauna was a great way to end a day of walking in the City before you went out for a drink and dinner.We normally walked everywhere (an hour and a quarter to the Museum D'Orsay) but when you get worn out or are in a hurry the Metro is easy and line 13 usually got us where we were going without the need to change lines.I really enjoyed this Hotel and location and I plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: stridhammar
Reviews.Content: La Fabe is a cosy little hotel in a quiet neighborhood near Tour de Montparnasse. The location is quite poor if you want to visit the traditional tourist sights. For example if you want to go to Tour de Eiffel you need to do a couple of stops on the subway and it takes some time to get there. If you have plenty of time and want to live in a typical parisian neighborhood, this is definitly the place for you. The staff is splendid and can help you with anything. If you want to use a shuttle service to the airport, make sure that you ask the hotel staff to book it for you on your arrival cause it might be hard to get one on the same dag as departure. Breakfast is a bit small but compared to what it cost to eat breakfast at a restaurant, it is good value for money. We got upgraded to their biggest room which was nice, but compared to what we are used to in Sweden it's still a bit small. Clean and very nice decoration thou. I really recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Le Fabe!”
Reviews.Author: bella_rossetti
Reviews.Content: Firstly, highest praise for Alexandre, who was absolutely wonderful from my first enquiry to my final goodbye. I booked in March 2010, asking if the hotel offered transfers from the airport. Alexandre kindly informed me that they didn't but gave me excellent directions on how to get to the hotel using the metro. In June he sent me a follow up email telling me about Yellow Van Shuttle http://www.yellowvanshuttle.com/ who did offer such a service. I was blown away that he had remembered my enquiry from 3 months before and booked my transfer the same day (GREAT service from them by the way). Due to unforseen circumstances I arrived in Paris on an earlier flight and subsequently got to the hotel at 09h40. Tired, desperately in need of a shower and a bed I prepared myself for a few hours' wait (check in is technically only from 14h00 onward). Alexandre said that they had had an early check-out and could possibly get me into my room a little earlier. Within 2 minutes I was seated at a table in their breakfast area with a steaming cup of hot chocolate and a plate of delicious pastries. Within 10 minutes, my bags had been taken up to the room and Alexandre escorted me up. I got my shower and was tucked into a heavenly comfortable bed with crisp linen by 10h30. THANK YOU SO MUCH Alexandre. You saved my life that day. The rest of my trip was amazing. The hotel staff were helpful, friendly and Le Fabe felt like home by the time I left. The room wasn't huge, but more than big enough for a solo traveller or a couple not travelling with 8 bags between them... There was always someone on duty to wish you good morning or good night and always wise counsel on best places to eat, places to visit etc. Pernety Metro Station is a 5 minute walk away and from there you can get to anywhere in Paris under a half hour. The immediate neighbourhood has everything and more you could need in terms of food: a bakery where you can get the freshest croissants and pain au chocolat's in the world, a cheese shop, wine shop, butchery and green grocer as well as 2 convenience stores and a chemist within walking distance if you forgot anything at home. A friend came to visit over a weekend and we got everything for a magnificent picnic within 2 blocks of the hotel. There is also a laundromat down the street, so you don't need to pack too much as you can just slip out for a quick hour/ two to do some laundry. I would highly recommend this jewel of a hotel. Hope you enjoy your stay as much as I did!

Reviews.Title: “Not central but very good.”
Reviews.Author: dogsbody689
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Paris on eurostar and travelled to local station pernety. Piece of advice: if ur travelling with a really heavy case get off at Montparnasse and take a taxi from there. I nearly died carrying the case up n down the stairs. Found the hotel very easily from metro and we were very pleased with the hotel once we were in the room. It was very clean with a huge bed. Didn't use the sauna at the bottom of the hotel but had a wander round and it looked good. If u need to check emails etc there is a business suite you can use. Although the hotel isn't central Paris my partner and I found it very easy to get to the centre and we were there in a matter of minutes. It's only 15 minutes to st Michel. Also, it was nice seeing an element of suburban Paris. The guy at the hotel recommended a lovely restaurant round the corner from the hotel and although we were the only ones in there the food was amazing! Well worth a visit. All in all a great parisian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Desire”
Reviews.Author: LeoHester
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff that welcomed us with a cappuccino and upgraded us to a bigger room (Desire, well chosen). The room and bed were cosy and comfortable. We liked the free sauna after a day of strolling through Paris. Montparnasse is a lovely neighbourhood with lots of good restaurants. We hope to come back to Paris and to this hotel very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: seamusconaty
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel that is very clean and modern. Staff were very friendly and obliging. Location was excellent, close the metro station. Would definitely stay there again, no complaints at all. Greeted so warmly on arrival and given a hot drink to warm us up, all the staff were really friendly. I left my shirt behind me and when we returned to collect our bags they had it for me neatly folded in a bag.....excellent customer service. The business suite with computer allowed us to check into our flight which was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Fab, funky and friendly”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeandFiona
Reviews.Content: We just spent a great weekend at Le Fabe Hotel. The staff were excellent, breakfast good, the decor modern and funky, nice and small, quiet and a change from the usual chains. The community of Penerty in Montparnasse is fantastic with lots of local shops and restaurants. You get the Air France coach from CDG airport to Gard Montparnasse, a 10 min walk from the hotel. We will use this hotel again and recommend it to others. It really is Fab!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: lightpacker70
Reviews.Content: Artisically decorated hotel with friendly staff and free wifi- what more can you ask for? My connecting flight to Paris was cancelled in Heathrow, luggage was lost, and flights I had planned to Spain was cancelled. Alex from the front desk was a Godsend. He spoke fluent English and helped me sort everything out. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Modern Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NishaLondon
Reviews.Content: I picked Le Fabe hotel based on the Tripadvisor reviews. What a great choice! Close to the Pernety Metro Station and in a nice neighbourhood full of bars, cafes, bakeries and restaurants. The metro took you into the centre within 10-15 minutes. The front desk staff are very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is 10 Euro's per person, we had it once but other times grabbed a croissant and coffee from the local bakery at a fraction of the price. The rooms are small but decorated to a high standard, absolutly perfect for a few nights stay to explore Paris. The bathroom is brand new and beautiful. We stayed in the room 'Desir', it was really good value for Paris. On our stay we visited Champs Elysee for the Christmas markets and Arch di Triomph. Eurodisney was also a great day with a lovely Christmas atmosphere. We had breakfast and hot chocolate at the famous Angelina's, ate Macroons from the master Pierre Herme and visited the Louvre. The Eiffel is a must-see more so in the evening when lit up, the restaurant on the 1st floor called Tour 58 was delicious, our best meal in Paris. The night cruise along the river seine was also spectacular. We celebrated my husband's 30th birthday in Paris and enjoyed every minute, staying at Le Fabe hotel made it perfect. A fantastic boutique hotel, lovely staff, stunning rooms in the best location to see this wonderful city - especially at Christmas! Will stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary boutique hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Lena024
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 2 days in November. The hotel is furnished to a really high standard, well designed bedrooms and bathrooms, with nice extras like good coffee machine. Breakfast area well presented with nice choice of continental breakfast. But the best thing is the service, its a 3* property with 5* customer service, will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: susan123j
Reviews.Content: This was the second visit to Le Fabe for my 22 year old daughter and myself. On both visits we had exceptional service from the entire hotel staff. From the time you enter the Le Fabe until you check out you are treated with such kindness., The front desk staff is extremely helpful with any requests you may have during your stay. Once you are escorted to your room, you will feel like you have walked into a very high class hotel.room. The rooms are beautiful and the bathrooms are extremely nice. This hotel is highly recommended my daughter and myself. If you choose to stay at the Le Fabe you will feel welcome your entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JackGovender
Reviews.Content: This 3 star hotel is quite superb and I would highly recommend it, Very close to the Metro station and shops and bars, etc. Very friendly, helpful staff especially Maxime and Alexandre. Always delightful and willingness to assist. Thank you for the excellent hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant stay!”
Reviews.Author: JPSM123
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay at Le Fabe Hotel. Myself and my partner had a great time in Paris and loved the city and all the food we sampled! thank you for all the coffees as well! We will definitely be returning to the hotel in the future,perhaps for our 1st yr wedding anniversary as my partner proposed to me whilst in Paris on Saturday at the top of the Eiffel Tower! it was also his birthday that day too! In terms of the hotel it is a great location and 3 mins away from Pernety station which is a good metro station to have close by as it takes less than half an hour to get to the main tourist areas and the latin quarter is about a 10 min walk! we would highly recommend the bistro about 2 mins down the road from the hotel called La Cantine and the pizza place opposite is good too! Thanks again for a fab stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Gregdob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small. I guess they have up to 20 rooms. So in overall it's quite calm. The interior is modern with optimistic colors. A free wifi is still not happening too often. The only complaint I could have was that we got the room on the ground floor therefore the window was covered with matt translucent film without possibility to open! Air-conditioning was not enough. That's the major drawback of the room we stayed in. For EUR10 you can buy breakfast which is modest but quite good. On the other side in the area you can also find nice brasseries with local taste. BTW in the area there are number of small restaurants which you can find on the way to metro which is 5-10min walking distance. For short trips I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ELBSeattle
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Le Fabe Hotel on the strength of the Trip Advisor reviews. The room was very reasonably priced (for Paris) and was clean, comfortable, very stylish and quiet. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and kind. The breakfast buffet is quite nice - don't expect an American brunch, but there is everything a reasonable person needs for breakfast. For 10â‚¬ it's quite a good deal, considering what one would pay for breakfast in a cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gurgery
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le fabe for 4 nights and it was great! the rooms are very nice and the staff was wonderful and helpful. Location is not bad. close to Prnety metro station and with the metro it's easy to go anywhere... Would defently return on our next holiday to beatful Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: violethaze
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for five nights and had a wonderful time. It was the first time for both my husband and I to Paris. The receptionist Alex and others are all very helpful and their English is great. There is supermarket, great bakery and wonderful local French restaurant just minutes away. The Penerty station is about 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel's decor is modern and elegant. Even it only has 17 rooms, it is very clean and new and has an elevator. It is not a tourist area so we got to see what the normal Parisian's life is like. It was fantastic and we will definitely recommend to anyone. The bakery Augustine and the local restaurant Le Cave something (sorry I can't remember the exact name) were the highlight. The pastry of the bakery and the French food in the local restaurant were definitely some of the highilght of our trip. The Internet was a bit let down due to the speed but I used the computer in the business centre instead and it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in a non-touristy neighborhood; great for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: geohab
Reviews.Content: Set on a corner in a non-touristy Montparnasse neighborhood, this small "boutique"-style hotel has a contemporary decor, friendly, helpful staff, and good location. It's an ideal spot for a single or a couple to stay for a day or two...The problem with a longer stay is that storage space for your stuff is non-existent! Decorated in minimalist style, someone forgot to include shelf space, dresser or drawer space, thimble-sized trash cans, and a decent-sized closet. Hard to get organized in a space like this...and we were told we had one of the "larger" rooms! Modest breakfast in the area by the front desk costs 10 euros pp, and coffee from the coffee machine--which is on all day--apparently is not complimentary. (When we checked out, we were billed an unexpected daily coffee charge because the staff said we drank a lot of coffee--definitely not a way to ingratiate yourself with a tripadvisor reviewer!!)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Gillian555-10
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel is in an interesting part of Paris and close to Montparnasse station and few minutes walk to metro station. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Very comfortable rooms, quite large for Paris and the bathroom was excellent. Breakfast is fresh and varied. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning little boutique hotel with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: darcee
Reviews.Content: What a lovely surprise Le Fabe Hotel proved to be. As hotels in Paris go, it was moderately priced, about 160 Euro for the double per night, but what you get for your money isn't always quite so much! We've stayed in Paris many times and would rate this as one of the best hotels for the price. Super easy to find, just 15mins from Le Garre and only 15 Euro by taxi. Amazing, charming, gorgeous welcome from the concierge, drinks and a comfortable seat while our booking was confirmed. Bags whisked off to our room. Modern elevator, business centre, sauna, coffee & tea complimentary. Not what you expect at a French hotel AT ALL. Lovely room, simple but comfortable and elegant decor. Super, wonderful, amazing, bed. Cannot possibly overstate how comfortable it was. One of the best beds I've ever slept on. Firm with a delicious softness on top. Clean, heavy, crisp sheets and heavenly pillows. I know, this all sounds a little over the top, but it really was a great bed, and a great night's sleep. No hint of traffic or other noises. Nice bathroom with lovely shower, great water pressure! Prompt wakeup call in the morning. Nice breakfast for just 10 Euro extra. Lots of little resturants and shops nearby, plus of course the essential subway station. The concierge was a great guy - we needed to change the time of our shuttle pick up, and he took care of everything, thank goodness as we don't speak french and wouldn't have had a hope! A helpful hint, allow an hour by car to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: EvaIosep
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night there but we are sure it is a very good choice. The staff speaks very good english and they are also very nice and warm. The room was perfectly clean ( we had one room with charme) the floor is not wood but anyway it was beautiful. The best thing is without a doubt the bed!! Great quality which is awesome to have after walking all day around the city. If they include breakfast would be perfect...

Reviews.Title: “utterly delightful - L.O.V.E.D this hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiresomelogin
Reviews.Content: the photos are entirely accurate - everything was as promised. a little acid green for my own personal taste but nonetheless, exceptionally clean, and for Paris a great boutique hotel for the money. Rooms are great, bathrooms fantastic - the showers are truly awesome. the proximity to a metro (literally around the corner) and the availability of cute little restaurants nearby meant that location proved to not be an issue at all. the staff really make this hotel special - they couldn't bhave been more delightful, helpful or charming. thank you very much Le Fabe.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jsl_00
Reviews.Content: Le Fabe is a great hotel! It is not particularly close walking distance to any of the main sights, and is more in a quiet residential area, but with lots of food options in the area. It is super close to a metro station so that it's still convenient to get around to the sights and shops. We arrived around noon and luckily our room was ready. The front desk was super friendly and helpful and took us to our room. The room was small as expected but clean and very boutique like. The decor was very very nice. The bathroom was spacious. There is free wifi access in the room as well as a business centre in the basement that is very nice. There is also a sauna, which we didn't use. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and I would definitely return here. The price is fair and the hotel is awesome, as long as you don't mind taking the Metro everywhere. Compared to hotels of a similar nature that would be right in the main tourist areas, you would probably end up paying double the price to go to one of those! Breakfast is not included at this hotel. I think it is 10 euro per person. We chose to just get food along the way instead of eating here.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Chic”
Reviews.Author: MissloveIbiza
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Le Fabe for 2 nights and 3 days. Having previously read reviews on Trip Advisor we felt that this was affordable and attractive looking and we wasnt let down. We had a ridiculously early Easyjet flight so I was worried we wouldnt be able to check in for hours once we arrived. Thankfully the kind man on reception said he'd do his best to get us into our room asap and offered us some hot drinks whilst we waited. In the end we only had to wait 45minutes and our room was ready and he told us that he had upgraded us which was nice! The hotel itself is small and charming. Each room has it's own name. Ours was called "Together" which we loved. The rooms are just gorgeous too, really nicely decorated and well put together. Our room wasnt huge but just a decent size for the time we were there. We loved the bathroom, it was so modern, clean and felt really new. Everything worked brilliantly too which was a bonus! The only downside was that we just had a view of a building and the road below but because of the location I wasnt expecting to be able to see the Eiffel Tower from where we were. Overall we really loved it and it just felt very individual and romantic. The location wasnt a massive problem for us as we just used the metro and did explore some of the local area. When we were really tired and fed up with walking it then felt like an inconvenience to us! But it was by no means a deal breaker for us. Having never been to Paris before I soon realised that actually it' s a very large city and not really the kind of place you can walk round the whole of. It took us a while to grasp the Metro but we soon got the hang of it and got our bearings. I am the kind of person who loves to stay central and be walking distance to everything so for me this was one thing that we were compromising on but I totally understood that a hotel of this quality based centrally would have cost us a fortune. The hotel charges 10 Euros per person for breakfast which we didnt take part in. When we had to wait for our room in the dining area we could see the breakfast looked nice but pretty basic - breads, jams, cereals, juices, coffee, tea etc. We felt it was better to get out in the city and sample some different Cafe's than just eat in the hotel but on reflection this was probably good value for breakfast as everywhere we ate was SO expensive. The highlights of our trip were.... The Eiffel Tower - I took some convincing to go to the top but i'm glad I did. The view was pretty impressive. Also not bad value at 13 Euros each. Parisians Bateaux Dinner Cruise - If you are going to Paris for the romance and general sightseeing I would really reccomend this company. When we booked our trip we didnt know much about them and wasnt sure if it would be value for money being quite expensive but it was worth every penny. We booked in advance online for an evening dinner cruise which lasted 1 hour and a half - 2hours at 65 Euros each. Included in this was a 3 course meal and the food was lovely! The best meal we had whilst there. We also were given 2 bottles of wine, one white, one red, and a bottle of water. Our bread basket was continually replenished also. We loved it! So nice seeing the tower lit up at night and such a nice vibe on the boat once it set off. There was a more expensive option which included champagne, a larger boat and live music and we said that night that if we had known it was going to be that good we would have gone for the more expensive trip. Definately worth doing! Our other highlight were the Luxembourg Gardens. It was such nice weather when we visited here and it just looked stunning and so relaxing. It was nice to take time out from all the walking to actually just sit, have an ice cream and enjoy the surroundings. This is actually walking distance from the hotel too. I would definately recommend Le Fabe to anyone who is going to Paris. You can't really go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Very very happy ! will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Barlaurance
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Fabe two nights only but i think it is the best choice i can find in the busy city such as Paris. The style of decoration in this hotel is very very nice and morden . Our room was spacious and had a large amount of storage compared to the normal European standard. I think the key point in this hotel is that it is very clean. The bathroom was clean and well-equipped. The hotel location is not like under Eiffel tower, but right next to the metro station and by that it is so easy to get to anywhere. Will com back for sure.!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, wouldnt stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: ryjan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights after reading recommendations on Trip Adviser. The hotel exceeded our expectations... for the price you will do no better in Paris. The hotel is basically brand new... and close to the metro. Staff were extremely helpful. It was the best hotel we stayed in during our 3 week european holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Truly fab - will stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ingunn12
Reviews.Content: We had two nights in Paris and were lucky to stay at Le Fabe. Great value for money, high quailty design of the rooms, attention to all details, very friendly and helpful staff. I thought the location was very good, subway stations round the corner and very nice food shops and restaurants nearby. we did not geta table at the basque restaurant the hotel recommends just down the street as it is chock full of locals every night, it looks amazing but we tried the suhi place Shiawase round the corner on Rue Decres and it was excellent. The hotel is not in the middle of all the sights and touristy places which obviously makes it better value but maybe for first timers to Paris less ideal if you do not enjoy walking or using the subway much. We went jogging to Jardin du Luxemburg every morning which is about 1km away from the hotel and enjoyed running in this beautiful parc with other locals. Close are Saint Germain des Pres with great shops and markets, the Sorbonne and Quartier Latin plus the Tour de Montparnasse. The hotel has a great little sauna in the basement with a shower and extra towels where you can book a session 30 mins in advance to relax after sight seeing. Only two cons: It was a little loud at night as the local juveniles practised their motorbike skills for hours but then we left the window open and I doubt it will be more quiet anywere else in Paris. Also the french pillows are too small and hard for my taste but that being the only downside of this place I will definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pleased”
Reviews.Author: CherylA222
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel with a warm and welcoming staff. Meticulously clean rooms, lovely layout, quiet and comfortable. Lots of little amenities to make your stay a pleasurable one. Greeted with coffee and a smile! Highly recommend this gem in the 14th.

Reviews.Title: “Other recommendations truly helpful, fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Snoop84
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set in Pernety. The metro is a 2 minute walk from the hotel and you can get to all the toursit attracttions within 10 minutes. Montparnasse is about 10 minutes walk and there are an array of shops and restaurants more reasonably priced then by the main tourist attractions. Hotel staff extremely helpful and had good knowledge of the area- they recommended us a great club to go on on our last night! Although it doesn't have a restaurant they do provide breakfast, which we didn't have, but it is resonably priced at 10 euros. There are loads of boulangeries within 2minutes that we picked up breakfast anyway! The hotel room was great. Everything is brand new- the rooms are large and bathroom was just as spacious. We were upgraded upon our arrival which was fantastic and the balcony looking on the main road gave a lovely Parisien feel! Great for couples as it's really quiet and peaceful. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A great and chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elenajps
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we stayed in Le Fabe Hotel for one night only but if i ever go to Paris again, i will definately choose to stay there. It was very nice, cosy, clean with modern decoration. Our room (Ephemere) was very spacious. The bathroom was just incredible. Staff was very helpful, friendly and english speaking. There was no breakfast in the price but you could eat anything you wanted from local stores nearby. It is quite close to a metro station but Montparnasse (department 14) is not in the heart of Paris and you will need to change 2-3 metro lines in order to get to your destination. The hotel is exactly as shown on the pictures. It is a great and very pleasant place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, staff are very accomodating,nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: skidmores
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near Pernety metro which you must use (get a paris visite travelcard for however many days you are staying) got lovely cakeshops and delis nearby.The hotel is very clean and the staff were always polite and attentive.Our room was modern and very nicely decorated but small but only slept there so not much required.They have free wi-fi and the coffee n chocolate machine served lovely drinks.Would recommoend the breakfast at 10E as coffee n coissant can be that much in a cafe and the hotel offer much more.There is a supermaarket over the road and we bought bottles of wine back to the hotel and the manager gave us an opener and 2 wine glasses without any argument.They even loaned us umberellas at no cost.would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price wont be diappointed”
Reviews.Author: soundsunscene
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights on a europe trip - being I was travelling a lot I had to budget somewhat but am fussy with hotels this was the perfect match (usually i stay 5 star if I can) - the cleanliness and modernism felt like an expensive hotel but the price was camparatible with a 3 star hotel u wouldnt want to stay in bottom line comfy bed modern clean friendly Parisian pleasantly surprised I love Montparnasse it makes me feel like I live in Paris as opposed to a tourist trap very close to Galleries Lafayette and a major train station once u navigate around but u will need to take transport but u are going to have to for the price pay and its easy and fun stay here if U are on a 100-15ish euro budget for sure cant go wrong

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat It”
Reviews.Author: CLord007
Reviews.Content: The reviews on tripadvisor were very helpful. Alexander is all that people claim he is: courteous, knowledgeable, polite... The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The location was ideal: close to the metro, cafes, etc. but away from the noise and congestion of the city. The metro system is very efficient so we never needed to take a taxi. Definitely staying at Le Fabe in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Five star service, super-trendy and modern dÃ©cor in a very quiet and safe part of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: AdsMan
Reviews.Content: The room: we paid â‚¬110 per night for room 14 (Arome). The room was exactly as on the website, with nice dÃ©cor. We had a queen size bed, bedside tables, desk, chair, safe and fridge. The bathroom was huge compared to our room size and was one of the funkiest bathrooms weâ€™d had in six weeks across Europe. Free Wifi. We didnâ€™t pay for breakfast. The hotel: A small, boutique hotel. Free cappuccino machine and tea making facilities in the dining room was a nice surprise. The service: five star service from every staff member here. We stayed here on our honeymoon and were welcomed with a free bottle of champagne on arrival! The staff were so friendly and were more than happy to assist with any request. All staff spoke excellent English. The location: located 250m from the metro stop, was in a quiet and safe neighbourhood. Itâ€™s a shame that itâ€™s not walking distance to any of the main sites, but this is a fair compromise considering what you pay. Furthermore, Paris is a big city, so no matter where youâ€™d stay, youâ€™d be forced to catch the metro when sight seeing. The conclusion: five star service, super-trendy and modern dÃ©cor in a very quiet and safe part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel In Nice Area”
Reviews.Author: Dinosaw
Reviews.Content: Le Fabe is a small boutique hotel just a few minutes walk from the Pernety metro stop on line 13 or ten minues from Gare Montparnasse. We booked a Cosy room for 100 euros but were upgraded to Charme on arrival where we were met with a friendly welcome and a nice coffee. This set the tone for our stay as the hotel staff were really pleasant and friendly thoughout our 3 nights at the hotel. The room (Desir) was spotless, well equiped and in a modern style, maybe a little on the small side for some people but fine for us. Buffet breakfast at 10 euros was good value as local cafes charge 7 euros for far less. We liked the surrounding area which has plenty of nice cafes and restaurants and the sights of Paris are easily reached by the metro. For 100 euros a night I thought Le Fabe was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't find better service!”
Reviews.Author: DollyInverness
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple nights here in June. the location was fab, just round the corner was a metro station that you could hop on to. There is an amazing restaurant down the road, 1 min walk - hotel recommended and it was delish and very reasoably priced. the rooms at this hotel were lovely decorated and the bathroom was very clean and spacious. The best part was the staff. Their english was great and we had a problem with our sister missing her flight and they could not have been any more helpful. I would highly recommend staying here. Great value for money! WOuld use again if I was visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LeeT911
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at Le Fabe for one night on a stop-over before a flight, but I liked the hotel very much. It's near Pernety metro station and not too far from Montparnasse train station. It's convenient to public transit and not in a very busy neighbourhood. My girlfriend and I got the Rugiada room, and I must say it looked exactly like the pictures they have on the website. Generally the pictures of hotels are always nicer than the actual rooms, but these pictures were spot on. Everything looked clean and well-kept, including the bathroom. The room had an espresso machine to make hot drinks. The worst part of our short stay there was also what made me appreciate this hotel the most. The hotel had helped us arrange a shuttle to the airport, but this shuttle was cancelled at the last minute (not the hotel's fault, they work with a company that offers the service). However, the two hotel staff who helped us deal with this situation were incredibly helpful. They worked very hard to find us a way to the airport (finally we took an Air France bus), and we made it in time even though our flight ended up being delayed. :) So I heartily recommend this hotel and I believe it's worth the price. I think this is the perfect spot for a romantic Paris getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy little hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Amy0404
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Fabe three nights. The hotel has a unique style of decor. Our room was the Mona Lisa, which was spacious and had a large amount of storage by European standards. The bathroom was clean and well-equipped. Although the hotel is not near the many tourist attractions, a metro station is within walking distance, making it easy to reach any part of the city within minutes. The staff was helpful in answering our questions and arranging a taxi for us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kaavya
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 days. It is located at 5 min walk from the metro with lots of restaurants near by which makes the stay very convinient. The breakfast is decent, there is free wifi & the room service is excellent. Though the room is not very big, it is comfortable. It is situated in a quiet locality which makes it all the more peaceful. Those who are looking for privacy, this is definitely the place to be..

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home! Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KerriW
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the beginning of June for the first part of our honeymoon. When we walked in, we were greeted by Alex who immediately knew who we were and was expecting our arrival. Within 2 minutes, he had grabbed our bags, placed them in our room that was a few feet from the reception desk, and had us sit down in the lobby to have some coffee. Once we settled in the room, which was spacious, with a gorgeous bathroom, we had found a bottle of champagne that was chilled with a handwritten "congrats on your marriage" note from alex. What a great touch! Alex spoke English really well and gave us many recommendations for getting around and where to go. Even though the other reception staff didn't speak english as well, they were able to help us with any questions we had for getting to many places. They were very knowledgeable. We loved the area. The metro was only a few blocks away-less than a 10 minute walk-and was a great line as it got us to most places really quickly with only a few line changes. The bakeries down the street were amazing and reasonably priced. A large baguette for one euro? YES please! We felt the area was safe and one night we walked to the area close to the bus station and found a busy nightlife street that had a hookah bar that we thoroughly enjoyed. I wish i could remember the street name but it was a straight 15 minute walk down rue de l'ouest. Our one regret was that we only stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We changed over to a hotel near the moulin rouge and were sorry we did as soon as we arrived. Le Fabe felt like home-the beds were so comfortable we had a hard time waking up (we had them set up 2 wake up calls per morning for us!). We loved the staff and the pernety area. The business center was nice since we did not bring our computer. Overall, our stay was wonderful and we were sad to leave. When we return to Paris we will definitely be staying at this hotel again. Also, we will be recommending it to friends. Thank you to Alex and all the staff for a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: SaysWho
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Our room was literally 5 feet away from the front desk, so it was a little strange. But our room was modern and very clean and was kept that way throughout our stay. We had tea, hot choc, and coffee with a little one-cup maker in our room. This was a great feature. Bathroom was lovely. The neighborhood was safe, with a few metro stop locations nearby. On Sundays, there is a great flea market nearby as well. Many pastry shops and restaurants within 3 blocks from hotel. Recommend: Aquarius (literally 20 steps from hotel- vegetarian, but great value, friendly), Le Cerisaie (near the cemetery, french food, our best meal).

Reviews.Title: “Great place, fantastic location, top notch for a 3 star place!”
Reviews.Author: alp_10
Reviews.Content: My wife are currentely writing this review on the Le Fabe FROM Le Fabe...using their free internet which is not as slow as some may seem to be saying. We have really enjoyed our stay here. The staff has been extremely helpful during our stay. Yes the location may seem a bit out of the way at first, but after our first day, we found it to be a real blessing. There are MANY places to grab food around the Le Fabe (including a handy mini-supermarket across the road). We had no issues with noise from the road. .Once we figured out the Metro system the distance was not an issue. Alexandre explained the Metro to us in a few minutes and we were away. Pernety station is right around the corner. A great tip, although it costs a bit, is to take a walk from Le Fabe to the Montparnasse Tower for dinner at Le Ciel de Paris. A reservation is necessary and Alexandre did a great job organising this for us with very little notice. Let me encourage you to consider this hotel. It is not perfection, but it is important to keep in mind that for 3 stars...this is a great hotel. My wife and I are able to review Le Fabe after spending the last few weeks travelling across Europe, staying in hotels all over the place. We booked this hotel based on the Tripadvisor reviews and we were really happy with our choice. We're off tomorrow morning and will look back on our stay with happy thoughts. Tomorrow also happens be Le Fabe's 2 year anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Le Fabe is way way overpriced, don't be fooled by their cool website!”
Reviews.Author: AndersonStarr
Reviews.Content: I was fooled by Le Fabe's cool website. This hotel is nowhere worth the price. Pros: - Free Internet access. - Alex, the main employee working there speaks good English. Cons: - Room was small. - Poor bathroom design. Shower/bath has a panel that covers only half of the area, so when showering, water gets out and gets the floor wet. - Small and very thin towels. - Extremely weak Wifi signal. Wasn't able to get a Wifi connection from our room at all. - Slow Internet. Luckily we brought our own cable and was able to get Internet access from the wall, but the speed was slow. - Poor location. The area looks okay during the day, but come night time, it was a bit scary. Drunks and homeless people on the streets and most stores closed. We also stayed in the Moulin Rouge area during our Paris trip, and stores there close much later than this area. - We spoke to one other employee when Alex wasn't around (didn't catch his name), he tried his best, but his English just wasn't very good. - The double bed was just two single beds put together. My girlfriend kept falling into the crack between the beds. Overall, this is just an extremely overpriced hotel. Don't make the mistake we made. Also, not making any accusations, but I really have a funny feeling about all these 5-star reviews this hotel got. Along with their beautiful website, let's just say they really know how to market themselves on the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific boutique hotel from which to base your exploration of Paris”
Reviews.Author: CdnTraveller001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Fabe in early-May and have nothing but good things to say about the hotel. First, the hotel is a great value: in a city where one can easily spend 200 to 300 Euros per night on an average hotel, the rates at the beautifully decorated and very well-maintained Fabe were very reasonable. The location was very close to the Metro (Pernety station), from which we found that we could easily get to all the sites of Paris. The Fabe is located in the Montparnasse area which isn't a touristic neighbourhood, but we felt this was a bonus. We generally tried restaurants and bakeries near the hotel. Since they were away from the tourist core, they were more reasonably priced (e.g., a croissant in the touristy areas of Paris would cost 2 to 3 times as much and the boulangeries or bakeries near the Fabe). The quality of food nearby was terrific too! The front desk staff were very helpful when asking about dining options and were very helpful with all questions about Paris. When it came to traveling around Paris, we used the excellent and efficient Metro system to get everywhere. A previous reviewer noted the size of the rooms. Perhaps this reviewer has never been to Paris, but most hotel rooms in the city are considerably smaller than those in North America. We found the size of the room to be standard sized for Paris and the bathroom was very lovely. The bed was very comfortable (another thing: often beds in France can be much harder than beds in N. America -- we found our bed at the Fabe to be very comfortable). There is some noise from the street below, but I imagine this is the case anywhere in Paris... the street isn't particularly loud, but Paris is like NY in that there are always people up and about. Bring earplugs if you need absolute quiet to sleep -- I slept quite restfully without any! The publicly accessible computer was also very handy when it came to researching activities or future portions of our visit to France. I highly recommend the Fabe and would definitely consider returning in future trips to Paris. Also one big recommendation while travelling in Paris -- don't hesitate to practice some French! The Parisians we spoke to were very gracious with our meagre attempts.

Reviews.Title: “stylish boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: gsoncnative
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel alone, because my husband was meeting me the next day due to business. The hotel is just as it looks in the photos-very modern and chic! I reserved the "cosy" because that's all that was available at the time, but was upgraded to the "desir". Though very happy, I was quite worried when he showed me to the room, because it was probably 20 feet from the reception dest on the first floor , and 2 feet from the breakfast room. However, it wasn't a problem.There was some noise in the morning due to breakfast preparations, but it was okay.The hosts are all very nice and helpful and speak excellent English.The bathroom was huge and very modern. The bed was extremely comfortable, especially the sheets.The air conditioning worked perfectly too. We loved the location in Montparnasse. It's like a small neighborhood quite close to restaurants and shopping. We actually walked to the eiffel tower, although it took about an hour, but was a beautiful walk. We were there three nights, and had dinner every night in Montparnasse, with lunch in center city, because we walked so much we were exhausted by late afternoon. Beware of the host's dinner recommendations. We had our last dinner at Chateau de l'oest, with one of the hosts saying it was great and he knew the chef. It was really bad.Country French can be great, although choices are weird like pork head pate an pork belly, but the food we had was really bad, tasteless and poorly seasoned. A great place to eat is Les Frangines, which is just around the corner from the hotel. We loved Le Fabe so much, and will definitely stay there again if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Chic”
Reviews.Author: KatSalnPea
Reviews.Content: Le Fabe is true to it's name - Fabulous! We arrived in Paris in mist of the snow storm, although the hotel is not right in the tourist area, it was very easy to find, about 5-10mins walk from the metro station. We were welcomed by Alex, who speaks perfect English, and helped us settled in smoothly. Before arriving in Europe, we were ready for the small hotel rooms, but Le Fabe was so considerate, they upgraded us to the Deluxe room, which was very spacious, especially the bathroom. The whole hotel was elegantly decorated with helpful staff always ready to answer our questions and give us suggestions. We stayed in Paris for 4 days, my husband and I wanted to avoid the tourist food, and experience the true locals. In the room's Hotel guide book, Le Fabe also listed the nearby restaurants and bars with detailed descriptions and comments. We decided to go with it, the staff helped us made bookings, and both restaurants turned out to be absolutely marvellous! We'll definitely go back to Paris, and look forward to staying at Le Fabe again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Location and tiny room”
Reviews.Author: daccas
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from visiting this hotel and am genuinely astounded at it's rating as #4 in Paris. I have been a regular user of TripAdvisor for 5 years and it has rarely let me down but on this occasion it most certainly has. The location is terrible. To give you an idea, it's â‚¬20 by cab to the centre of Paris (yes, you can use the Metro but this gives you an idea of how far it is from the centre and if you have lots of luggage you probably won't fancy using the metro which is another 5 min walk from the hotel). It's also situated on a busy street and is very noisy at night time. Our room ("Desire") was tiny and the bath towels were the size of hand towels. Finally, when we checked in we specifically asked (as we always do) if Breakfast was included in our rate and we were told it was. We had breakfast (which was very basic (cereals and bread) and when we came to check out they had added â‚¬10pp to our bill for breakfast. We explained we specifically asked if it was included and the guy just said he must have mis-understood our question but we'd still have to pay. We ended up paying Â£135 per night which isn't exactly cheap and given the location of the hotel and the size of the room it did not represent good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Personal Service - Noisy Street”
Reviews.Author: gmanka
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel, with free Wi Fi, and excellent personal service. The rooms have been renovated and are modern, trendy and very clean, though a bit small (like every hotel in Paris). The only negative point was the traffic noise from the street. Don't forget to bring your ear-plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Oaisis”
Reviews.Author: DtownVivian
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Le Fabe for a week with my sister. Le Fabe was our Parisian refuge and such a great part of our trip. We absolutely LOVED this neighborhood in Montparnasse... We saw very few tourists but many shops, restaurants, cafes, pastry shops, cheese shops, wine shops! abound to give you the authentic Parisian neighborhood experience. Metro is two blocks and we ended each day of sightseeing at "Au Metro" cafe across from the metro stop each night with a bottle of wine and a cheese platter, amidst many locals! Took Air France Shuttle #4 from CDG for 16 Euros to Gare Montparnasse which is 4 blocks and easy walk to hotel. We ate the 10 Euro continental buffet each morning and brought it up to our room while watching the morning life on the street! was delicious and a great value, considering we would drink 10 euros for two cappaucinos alone in a cafe. Cappucinos unlimited ;) Staying at Le Fabe reminds me of the cool House Music vibe of staying at the Westin in San Francisco... if it were a boutique European hotel... rooms are small but bed super comfy, bathoom is very modern and shower pressure awesome, room immaculately clean ..Mini-bar holds beverages, drug store right across street to get your own, in room safe. Hair dryer and Aromatherapy bodywash face wash. Computer with Internet to use was helpful to use email. Quiet neighborhood = undisturbed sleep with blackout shades! We stayed in Mona Lisa which is one of bigger rooms, definitely upgrade. Service at Le Fabe is the best I have every experienced at any hotel, bar none. Service is definitely 5 Star and not 3. From the moment we arrived jetlagged, the most beautiful cappacuino was whipped up for us to enjoy in the lounge while our bags were taken. Anything we desired was very professionally accomodated for us, from the borrowing of wine glasses and corkscrew to the mapping of Latin dancing clubs, but at the same time not overly invested. Alex is most outgoing and superb!! But all three hosts we worked with spoke English and accomodated our any need! Would obviously recommend and stay again! Bon Chance!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel - will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: Guarania
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant hotel! If you go to Paris you should definitely stay here! The rooms are beautiful (due to spontaneous extensions of our stay we got to see three rooms) - stylish and clean, the staff is very friendly and I enjoyed the stay here very much. I can highly recommend the hotel! The only let downs were the really slow internet connection (but it was free, so I don't want to complain too much) and that the walls are rather thin. But the thin walls still did not decrease my sleep quality. So if you go to Paris - go to Le Fabe Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “New, clean and a great staff”
Reviews.Author: el415
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in Paris with the airports closed because of the Icelandic volcanic ash cloud at the end of our stay in Paris. Not only did the staff at Le Fabe bumped others off so we could stay in our rooms, they also called the airlines, train station and other hotels for us numerous times. The rooms are clean and contemporary. There are plenty of places to eat around the area. Very safe neighborhood. The only knock on this place is that the rooms are a bit small. But for your money you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, with outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: 84wessex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Fabe for 2 nights for a short break in Paris. Although the hotel is a little way from the centre, this is reflected in the price, and what you get is a beautifully decorated and presented boutique hotel with outstanding service. The staff, especially Alex, could not have been more helpful, and the room, while small, was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The breakfast, at 10 Euros each, is good value and plentiful. It sets you up well for the day. We used the Velib bike hire stations to get around and cycled everywhere in Paris in the short time we were there. The bikes are cheap (almost free if you can return them on time or find a Velib station with free slots) and in excellent condition most of the time. The Velib stations are everywhere. We cycled from the hotel to the Eifel Tower, and all the sites south of the river, plus from the Sacre Cour, back to the hotel via the Eifel Tower at night (about 8 miles through Paris)!! I would certainly stay at Le Fabe again if I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely slow internet / ethernet”
Reviews.Author: HappyBelly
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because the reviews commented on the fast internet. However, our ethernet connection was extremely slow (and we could never see the wifi from our room). The lobby was crowded with people complaining about the Internet in the lobby on our first night because it didn't work at all, when we got it back on the second day it worked but extremely slowly. This is how slow it was during our three-day stay: half of the links off of Google news didn't work, I couldn't lgo into my yahoo email account, and anything that needed to be secure failed (purchasing anything online, checking accounts). No videos could be streamed. The workaround was to go to the publicly available computer, but this is an annoying workaround. The receptionist at the desk admitted that the hotel rooms were on a different system than the publicly available computer, and didn't seem surprised when I said that my hotel room internet was slow. Another couple at the hotel said they could watch videos on their iphone on the wifi, so maybe if we could have seen the wifi access point, it would have been faster. We had one of the more expensive rooms which was clean and spacious and quiet (but maybe it was too far away from the wifi access point?). If you're the type who travels with a laptop, I would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & modern with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: mrswaves
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently and had a completely great stay. Very helpful staff that answered any questions we had. Hotel is near good cafes/bakeries/bars that we enjoyed walking to. Train is minutes away and with a map from hotel reception we went all around Paris very easily. The room was clean, nicely decorated & was perfect for us. This was our first trip to Paris and Le Fabe was a fantastic choice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: margiepie
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for No. 1 night stay in Paris as It Was near Gare Montparnasse and we HAD to catch a train From There FOLLOWING the morning. goal we would go out of Our Way to stay there again. The rooms were excellent. Perfectly Formed small object with a spotless bathroom and shower glitteringly A Powerful. The Bed was comfy and the breakfast was ample and relaxed. Were the guys are just great reception. Friendly, well-Judged service and a great recommendation for a nearby restaurant, booked for Which THEY us. Top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Gas75
Reviews.Content: Checked TripAdvisor before the trip and found this hotel. I'm glad that all reviews were correct. This is an excellent choice for all. Especially for couples that want peace and quiet in a clean and tidy room after a day's city visit. Room service cleaned every day and clean sheets every other day. Free and fast wi-fi one of the highlights. Polite and helpful staff. We had a free room upgrade. The only 'gray' spot is that breakfast could be included at the price. I would definitely go there again next time i'll visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Spot”
Reviews.Author: Brainechick
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Paris. La Fabe was a dream -- the concierges were very helpful and the room was soooo comfortable. My boyfriend never gets relaxed in hotels and he felt totally at home. The bed was so big and soft, and the bathroom was very spacious, and the shower was great. Wall are not soundproof: you can hear people walking around immediately outside of your door, but not conversations. The breakfast area is a little small, but its to be expected in a boutique hotel; the food was good and there was a nice variety. The metro a two block walk and there are LOTS of restaurants surrounding. We will certainly be back--my boyfriend is only afraid too many people will find out about this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teppe
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Le Fabe Hotel to anyone! The rooms are lovely decorated, very clean and modern. The bathroom is like new. The rooms are not the biggest, but not too small either. On a city trip, you don't need a big room anyway. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. The breakfast is optional for 10 Euro pp and is simple, but good. (Cereals, juices, coffee/tea, different breadchoices, charcuterie, cheeses, marmelade,croissants,...) The location of this hotel might be a little bit out of the centre (in Montparnasse), but a metrostation is around the corner. Another nice option is to use the Velib-bikes, which you can find all over Paris. A Velib-post is just next to the metrostation as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Di0nysia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in February 2010 with my partner. Service was excellent. Everybody really keen to help (but not over keen) and make our stay enjoyable. Great, simple breakfast (coffee could have been a bit better). Nice residential location, very close to the metro and away from the tourist crowds. Room very clean, nice powerful shower. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fab”
Reviews.Author: LucyCarvalho
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at this hotel the last time we passed through Paris. The hotel is located close to many restaurants around Montparnasse train station. The staff was very helpful and made a point to take us to our room, a first in 3 star hotels in Paris. The room was nicely decorated, quiet, with comfortable bedding and a sparkle clean and modern bathroom. The best however was the breakfast: a selection of fruits, juice, cheeses, cured meat, bread, cereals, hot drinks all for a mere â‚¬10 per person. I cannot think of staying anywhere else for the price we got it for (Â£85 through laterooms.com) !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Kirsty71
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived, everything was great about this hotel. The staff are excellent - very friendly, courteous and helpful. The rooms aren't huge, but are well appointed, with good quality fittings. The buffet breakfast is good, and overall value for money very good. I would certainly consider returning here on future trips to Paris. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Le Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: avrasou
Reviews.Content: This fabulous hotel is located near Pernety metro station,in a charming parisian neighbourhood with plenty of bakeries,super markets,restaurants,etc. Rooms are exactly as shown in the pictures of the site and even better!!We stayed at the "Lotus" room. Everything was clean and the bed was great(especially the pilows).The coffee/tea/chocolate maker in room was really convenient. And of course everyone at the reception desk was really kind and helpfull! Highly recommended!

HotelInfo.Name: Le Fabe Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 113 bis, Rue de l'Ouest, 75014 Paris, France
